175501.name: Horrors of the Void
175501.description:
User summary:

A setting expansion for Void Vultures.

175502.name: Dreadnoughts of the Void
175502.description:
User summary:

A shapeship supplement for Void Vultures.

175503.name: The Lost Expedition
175503.description:
From Introduction:

In the dawning years of the last wars, back before anyone knew that these conflicts would destroy human civilization, the Explorer-class ship NFH Bulbar left the solar system. Its mission was to investigate Tunnicliffe, a rogue neutron star that was travelling past Sol. To accomplish this trick, it was equipped with an experimental star drive which would allow it to break the light barrier.

NFH Bulbar was escorted to Saturn’s orbit, activated its drive, and streaked into the inky-black cosmos. The groundbreaking technology of the star drive promised to bring the ship back in three short months.

The star drive did not deliver on said promise.

Two weeks ago, however, a new point of light appeared outside the orbit of Saturn. NFH Bulbar is terribly late, but it has finally arrived. Of course, it finds a solar system drastically changed, teetering on the brink of starvation and civilization-wide collapse. And as one might expect, not all is well on board, either…

NFH Bulbar is a level five derelict written for five players. As with any other derelict, the level is trivial to shift up or down. To make a derelict a higher level, add dice and squares to damage tracks; to lower the level, remove them. Exactly how many to add or remove can be found in the NPC Rül in Rüls of the Void.

175505.name: Havets konung
175505.description:
- En kappsegling runt Gotland (A race around Gotland).

The players competing in a race around the Island Gotland in the Baltic sea. The boats are moving by picking up the right picture from facedown tiles that correspond to a field in front of the playing piece. If a wrong tile are picked, then the boat have to move back. The tiles are put back in the same place and after a while you have to trust your memory to pick the right tile.

175506.name: samurai_jazz
175506.description:
User Summary

This platformer follows you as a samurai swordsman through 5 acts. While you discover most of the game as you go along, the basic battle controls are in two buttons and every enemy can be tough to beat. There is a retro 8-bit graphic and sound system, and typical samurai enemies and demons, but also a fair bit of trial and discovery as you seek to explore and pull together clues concerning your mission.

175507.name: Open Field Battle
175507.description:
Open Field Battle is a simple wargame portraying generic 17th-century combat; no specific battle is represented.

Each player has a force of pikemen, cavalry, musketeers, and cannons. Each turn a player gets a random number of command points to spend on musketeers and cannons firing and on pikemen and cavalry moving and assaulting.

Combat is deterministic; the result depends on the formation the defender is in and the status of the defender and any neighboring units. E.g., a lone defender or one at the end of a line is disrupted (or eliminated if already disrupted), but one with two undisrupted neighbors merely retreats. The neighboring units may suffer effects as well.

Optional rules allow for different ways of using the command points and the possibility of saving them from turn to turn.

175508.name: Credo!: The Game of the Early Church
175508.description:
As in the original Credo, in Credo!: The Game of the Early Church players compete to get their versions of the articles of the Nicene Creed voted in. There are numerous event cards which affect the proceedings.

This edition makes some significant changes, among which are:

The game can be played with up to eight players, although play mats for just six are provided.
The alternate winning conditions (11 million flock or 117 council votes) have been eliminated.
The game ends when the creed is complete or when the event deck is exhausted.
The creed is divided into 13 articles instead of 10, and there are furthermore additional optional articles (designated X, Y, and Z) which the Emperor can choose to vote on at any time. (Consequently, players can have up to 12 articles on their mats instead of 9.)
All flock cards have the same value.

175509.description:
Tactical GameX is a new interpretation of the classic Avalon Hill games PanzerBlitz and Panzer Leader. An effort has been taken to bring the play of these games into the 21st Century. Rather than moving all units at a time, players swap impulses, moving an unknown number of units at a time. There are also options to turn the game into a card-driven system complete with random events.

My inspiration for creating this new rules set was the vast (and I do mean vast!) number of supplemental units and maps created by the folks at the Imaginative Strategist. The goal was to create a system that was fully backward compatible with the classic games, but provide a more interactive and suspenseful experience with the option to play with armies from all the nations fielding substantial armies during World War 2.
175509.name: Tactical GameX

175510.description:
In Soulfall, players lead their nomads across a barren landscape, saved from the brink of destruction by a collective of powerful Lords. Along the way, players can devote themselves to these Lords, build outposts, and gather shards, all while trying to prevent the other players from doing the same.

Soulfall is a medium-light game that combines simple mechanisms, medium strategy, stunning artwork, clever card play, and a unique scoring system.
175510.name: Soulfall

175511.name: Chronicles of a Dark Lord Episode 1
175511.description:
User Summary

This Japanese style RPG features you as the prophesized dark mage who will become the great new leader in the battle between dark and light forces.

175512.name: A Chaotic Life!
175512.description:
A Chaotic Life is a tiny card game with MASSIVE story and more than a few bad decisions! Create your life strategy - adapt when your opponents ruin it!
Work with or against your opponents to raise a baby through the 7 stages of life - both choosing its actions and accepting the consequences - to ultimately live a wonderful (or terrible) life!

Players will take turns drawing and playing cards. These represent events in the life of the baby (later adult), and may generate "Happiness" or "Sadness" counters for the player. A card's outcome is affected by the cards that have been played before.

At the end of the game, the player that has collected the most "Happiness" or "Sadness" counters (depending on the goal set at the beginning of the game) wins the game.

175513.name: Lord of the Rings: Journey to Rivendell
175513.description:
UNRELEASED GAME - CANCELLED




This game was cancelled in development. Please only submit images if you own a copy or have legal access to this item.




User Summary

Lord of the Rings: Journey to Rivendell first appeared in a 1983 Parker Brothers catalog as a 'coming soon' game for the Atari 2600. Unfortunately it was never released due to copyright issues leading many to think that the game was never built. Twenty years later, a former Parker Brothers employee gave a prototype of the game to the operator of the AtariAge website. Surprisingly, the game was quite complex and seemed to be complete.

The game essentially recreates the action from Book 1 in The Lord of the Rings novel. You play the roll of Frodo Baggins trying to safely journey from Hobbiton to Rivendell while being relentlessly pursued by Dark Riders. You may use the ring to hide from spying birds but this also speeds up your pursuers. You may also meet several characters from the book including Sam Gamgee, Strider and Gandalf, along with the usually neglected characters of Tom Bombadil and Glorfindel who all give you special powers to aid you in your flight.

175514.name: Magical Maiden Madison
175514.description:
User Summary

A Twine visual novel parodying magical girl anime such as Sailor Moon.

175515.name: Even Cowgirls Bleed
175515.description:
User Summary

A text adventure about heartbreak in the West... with shooting gallery sections.

175516.description:
HOOK: The movies Alien and Escape from Alcatraz meet 3-Card Monte meet the spin cycle of your washing machine!

In MoonQuake Escape, get ready to face the challenges of the spinning, changing 3D surface of the doomed prison planet of Zartaclaton. A massive MoonQuake grants you sudden freedom from your captivity, but there's only one way to Escape--the last rescue rocket, and you need to reach it before the other players. Use the rotating and revolving 3D moon to gather charges and decide which actions will best meet your goal: finding and stopping others players, readying or stealing key equipment, or finding better ways to hide. Along the treacherous journey, watch out for shifting and dangerous terrain, out of control defenses, and a relentless prison guard that are out to end your sentence--for life!

Finding and stopping the other players is your best plan, but each is hiding amongst decoys and traps. Player interaction focuses on a risk fraught variation of the classic 3-card Monte combined with a thematic "Bluffing" component that completely reverses the "Take That" mechanic. Can you use protective shields to lure opponents into picking the wrong hiding spot and keep your own plan from backfiring? Reach the rocket and prepare for a climatic battle--will you be prepared to capitalize on unexpected turn of events? Be the first to launch during the MoonQuake and you've Escaped the competition!
175516.name: MoonQuake Escape
boardgamepodcastepisode: 4. Devon Dice podcast, review of 2015 part 2
Vox Republica 110: Pandemic, Patchwork, and Patreon

175517.name: Rasslin' Strategy
175517.description:
Rasslin' Strategy is a 1990 pro wrestling card game by Mike Besky that normally requires (if not using an alternate rule) that the game be played WHILE wrestling is on, specifically wrestling that neither player has seen yet (original airdates, PPVs, etc).

The cards, which are moves like Choke, Bodyslam and Dropkick, are realistically and competently illustrated black and white images with a few rules and values that are used to resolve success and score points. Gameplay involves playing cards from your hand that match those being performed in the currently playing matches on your television (if the match you're watching has Shawn Michaels using a dropkick, you can play Dropkick).

The goal is to pin your opponent of course, by playing the correct cards/sequences to end the match.

175518.name: Cell Phone Love Letter
175518.description:
Two stories of two seperate, young girls: Hazuki, an artist struggling to find recognition or purpose, and Yamazaki, a hacker who inadvertantly falls in love with a girl. Their stories are seperate, but they are both connected by a single theme: long distance relationships, love via e-mail.

Source: The Developer Website.

175519.name: Heart of Fire
175519.description:
The three travellers had never met each other before being captured by monsters, but they now have one thing in common: their struggle to escape from hostile lands together. A goofy overblown love story about killing orcs and letting the fire in your heart keep you strong.

Source: The Developer Website.

175520.name: Cards Against Humanity: Retail Pack
175520.description: Cards Against Humanity: Retail Pack is a 5-card expansion for Cards Against Humanity. It is included with a purchase of the base game from a physical store that was accepted into Cards Against Humanity's retailer program.

175521.name: Sketchbook: Schoolgirls in Love and Other Assorted Heartbreak
175521.description:
A slice-of-life melodrama that's all about the important parts of growing up: falling in love with another girl, impeaching a corrupt student council president, sex, and not colouring within the lines.

Source: The Publisher Website.

175522.name: Diving Deeper
175522.description:
Five minutes of non-interactive tentacle porn.

Source: The Developer Website.

175523.name: Spaß am Lesen
175523.description:
"Reading is fun" is the game for 1st and 2nd graders.

There are 81 picture cards, 34 word tiles and 140 letters.

One of the variants:
Players must take the word tiles and find the letters from the table needed for those tiles. If all letters are found, the picture card must be find. Who is the first to find certain number of picture cards is the winner.

175524.name: Spaß am Rechnen
175524.description:
"Computing is fun" is the game for 1st and 2nd graders.

There are 48 puzzle cards: 24 with numbers and 24 with images.

In his turn player takes any number tile and must find the image tile with same number of elements. If correct take the tile as a point, if incorrect put both tiles back. If all tiles are taken who has the most tiles is the winner.

May be played also as a Memory.

175526.name: Brenner
175526.description:
From publisher blurb:

Fighting with Fire

“I am a brenner, a mental with the power to control fire. By using pyrokinesis I can warm a cold room, light a candle, or singe the hair off your head from a hundred yards away. If you’ve managed to ignite my temper, I can also roast you with a mere thought. It may not be legal to do that, but my kind often find themselves on the wrong end of the law.

It’s easy to find lucrative work using my destructive talents, but I’m more than just a stack of kindling waiting for a spark. Most people take my kind to be one-trick ponies, but I enjoy welding, picking lots, driving fast, and long walks on the beach as much as the next person. I may be hired to set people on fire, but my other skills are what set me apart from brainless thugs with giant guns.”

Psi-punk Archetypes: Brenner is the first of a line of sourcebooks for Psi-punk, a Fudge Cyberpunk RPG. Brenners are masters of pyrokinesis which gives them the ability to control fire with their minds. This supplement provides further insight into the archetype and offers suggestions for skill selections, Gifts, Faults, and Gear that would be useful to any brenner.

175527.name: Athach Mindclaw
175527.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to Mindblast! Villains Augmented. This is a series of psionic supplements designed to help you run games using the rules from Psionics Unleashed by Dreamscarred Press.

This product aims to give you a monsters with a psionic flair with a single, detailed nemesis for cheap. Everything you need to use these monsters is included here.

Presented here is the gruesome Athach Mindclaw!

175528.name: Cast Tower of the Blood Moon Rises!
rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
175528.description:
From publisher blurb:

An Adventure for 2nd and 3rd-Level DCC RPG Characters

"Beware the power of Ruzzick–Tol,
Conqueror of Nature and Death.
Time defeated rewinds the soul,
Renewing one last breath."

Terror pillages the minds of those rooted within Hallowstone Valley; their Thane's daughter lost and their families tormented by the arrival of a murderous beast! Before the villagers can be unbound from fear, adventurers brave enough to lend hand will find themselves plunging down a mysterious spiral of betrayal, half–truths, blood magic, and death — eventually gaining possession of an extraordinary artifact of an immortal but perilous nature. What happened to Torene? Who was Harfin Hazelnook? And what has spawned the beast which now preys on the weak of Thanesmire? The answers await only those courageous enough to seek them out!

Features:

A full, 68 page adventure with history, items, dangers, and mysteries for your PCs to explore!
Beauitiful illustrations throughout by artist Jay Rasgorshek!
An interactive player handout that will have your DCC RPG group continuing to explore the world long after the adventure is complete!

175529.name: Atomic Monster Hero
175529.description:
From publisher blurb:

New from D3 Adventures and Michael Surbrook: Atomic Monster Hero! Thrill to the origins of atomic monsters in your campaign! Scream in terror as their powers are examined! Flee from their horrid appetites!

Pray their weaknesses can be exploited! Marvel at the Atomic Wasps, Giant Sea Scorpion, and the Sentient Slime Mold (from Space)!

175530.name: The Grand Mêlée (Pathfinder)
175530.description:
From publisher blurb:

In the middle ages there was little to no organized sport as we know it. Oh, there were sports and games aplenty, and any time traveler could go back and find the distant (or not so distant) ancestors of such modern games as field hockey, football (i.e. soccer), lawn bowling, and even baseball. But there were no regulated sports with one exception.

This was the tournament, a martial sport performed by the nobility, of the nobility, and for the nobility. Tournaments were often planned well in advance (up to a year or more), featured a great deal of pomp and spectacle, and often had carefully spelled out rules for what would be (and would not be) allowed. Best of all, a tournament might last for a week or even longer, and would bring a great influx of people and money to whatever town was lucky enough to have one held nearby. Thus, a medieval tourney makes for an excellent Pathfinder scenario, and can feature all the action and adventure a GM and his players may wish for -- even if no one is actually fighting in the tournament itself!

The latest addition to the Surbrook's Stuff product line will jousting with the best of them.

175531.name: Era: The Consortium Rulebook Primer
175531.description:
From publisher blurb:

Humanity has left Earth over a thousand years behind, landing on a new planet and founding a new government. The Consortium is an inspiring ideal - three star systems teaming with life and four species living and working together. As time passes, however, cracks are showing in the Humanity-led society and those less scrupulous have taken power.

Enter at any point in 500 years of playable story, following the Consortium's growth from a small colony to a multi-system economic and political establishment. Explore new worls and encounter alien races, direct or fight in battles which span a solar system and will decide the future of the Consortium or join a Resistance movement against the government to save or destroy billions of lives!

What you decide will define the future of the Consortium.

This book includes a single sample session.

175532.name: Era: The Consortium Rulebook Primer v0.7
175532.description:
From publisher blurb:

Humanity has left Earth over a thousand years behind, landing on a new planet and founding a new government. The Consortium is an inspiring ideal - three star systems teaming with life and four species living and working together. As time passes, however, cracks are showing in the Humanity-led society and those less scrupulous have taken power.

Enter at any point in 500 years of playable story, following the Consortium's growth from a small colony to a multi-system economic and political establishment. Explore new worls and encounter alien races, direct or fight in battles which span a solar system and will decide the future of the Consortium or join a Resistance movement against the government to save or destroy billions of lives!

What you decide will define the future of the Consortium.

This book includes a single sample session.

175533.name: Era: The Consortium – The Time Travel Campaign Part 1
175533.description:
From publisher blurb:

Experience Time Travel!

Travel back to the beginning of the Consortium with a special mission, and live through the following years shaping history as you see fit!

175534.name: One-Legged Zombie Chicken
175534.description:
A necromantic ritual in a chicken farm marks the beginning of a horror night full of dreary cackles. In ONE-LEGGED ZOMBIE CHICKEN, players try to use the resources of a trapped population to escape from hungry zombie chicken. Use the characters' powers, get rid of the chicken cards and be the survivor of this gallinaceous apocalypse.

In each turn, a player must make three actions in sequence: 1) replace their hand until acquiring 6 cards; 2) throw out a card on the discard pile; 3) play a character card and activate its power. It's important to highlight that chicken cards can NEVER be discarded. Each character activates a special power setting the gaming dynamics.

175535.name: Orctions
175535.description:
Nominated for UK Game Expo 2015 Strategy Card or Dice Game of the Year.
Bid. Build. Battle.
Orc Warlords buying Orc Slaves at Orction to then fight to the death in Gladiatorial Combat.
Uses a variety of classic auction techniques and a blend of worker placement strategy to build a gladiator school of Orcs.
Culminates in combat via a dice system of d4 and d6 based on Orc and Gladiator equipment gained.
Players bid on Orc Lots from a deck of 84 individual Orcs in 7 categories to build sets. Orctions occur when a player decides to visit the city of Ve'Tath during the worker placement rounds. Orctions are in 6 different styles. Once one player has the designated number of sets they win stage one of the game and then decide which pairs of other players must fight in the dice combat game in the arena until there is only one Orc left alive. The player who has this Orc is the winner of the entire game.

175536.name: Moscow Embattled, 1941: the Minigame
175536.description: This mini - even micro - game has just the 6 German armies/panzergruppen and 9 Russian army and front units, plus 2 air units for each side. 3 hexes from Smolensk to Moscow. Uses Dark Crusade's, Tiger Attack's, and Darkest Crusade's simple firing point/hit system. 20-day turns as in Moscow Defended! Blitzkrieg. Siberians. A half-hour-lunch game, FREE to print off and play from CoatneyHistory (where the rules are).

175538.name: Strat
175538.description:
Strat is an easy game to learn. It is not a game of chance.

Each game is a unique adventure itself. Your only ally is your strategy.

Strat can be played with two or four players. The goal is to earn as many points as possible stealing your opponents’ pieces and placing them in safety on the points squares. Following the rules for moving pieces, players strive to capture their opponents’ pieces and stack them in towers. But watch out. If you don’t have the best strategy, your adversary will be the one collecting the points!

If you like games where winning is all up to you, Strat will offer you a world of strategic possibilities.

As easy to learn as checkers but as strategic to play as chess!
Beware: the simple rules are not what they seem!

175539.name: Five Tribes: Fakirs
boardgameaccessory: Five Tribes
175539.description: Five Tribes: Fakirs is a set of 18 cards, each featuring a fakir, that can replace the slave cards used in the first edition of Five Tribes. No rules have changed in the game.

175540.name: Side Quests Volume 1
175540.description:
From publisher blurb:

Side Quests are short side trek excursions for your PCs which can be played in a single sitting. There are four such adventures contained within this single volume, the first of many to come from AdventureAWeek.com / AAW Games!

Contagion A Pathfinder Side Quest by Will Myers for four PCs of levels 5-6
Elves have appeared in Rybalka and are on the search for something ancient. Will the PCs uncover their plot, try to stop them, or join them?

Giant's Cavern A Pathfinder Side Quest by Stephen Yeardley for four to six PCs of levels 8-11.
A distraught but angry and determined cleric is looking for a group to work with her to recover the bodies of her former allies and a specific weapon which was the cause of their deaths. However, she needs reassurances that she won't be cheated and demands a heavy deposit for her information, which will lead to greater rewards.

Serpens Sanguis A Pathfinder Side Quest by Jonathan G. Nelson for four PCs of levels 9-11.
An ancient cult of maniacal dragon worshipers known as Serpens Sanguis once dwelled deep within a hidden sanctuary buried beneath a tall mountain peak but in recent years the cult has grown deathly silent, all that is left are rumors of powerful magicks and a great treasure hoard which awaits those brave enough to enter.

Turn again, Turn again A Pathfinder Side Quest by Stephen Yeardley for four to six PCs of levels 8-12.
When the gods and demi-gods were young, fresh and inexperienced, they were often taken in by the duplicitous nature of some of their "worshipers", falling for flattery and deception from those who were a little more "worldly-wise". So some of the newer demi-gods devised a series of chests that responded to the actual nature of the person opening it, thus revealing their true selves. These chests were filled, placed in a hidden and challenging spot and watched by two of these deities - to ensure fair play - for when experienced followers, who a particular deity wanted to help develop further, came along.

175541.description:
Cuisine a la Card is a competitive deck-building card game for 2 - 4 players.

You are up-and-coming Chefs, crafting the finest and most elaborate dishes out of the ingredients available to you, and submitting those dishes to a discerning panel of Judges to win Medals. In this cut-throat world of culinary competition, Tasting Spoons are your currency, your Warming Tray may be your greatest asset or your worst nightmare, and a simple dash of Salt may just be what you need to tip the balance in your favor and win the game.

On their turns, Players use their Tasting Spoons, and Forks, to purchase Ingredients available in the Marketplace. Ingredients are added to their decks, or placed into their Warming Trays, and Players use those Ingredients to submit Dishes to Judges. Those Judges reward the Player with Medals, as well as passive abilities that could turn the tide of the game. The Player with the most Medals wins the game.

Cuisine a la Card is fast-paced and challenging as Players have to constantly manage their decks and shift strategies to outwit their opponent and ensure that they are the winning Chef.
175541.name: Cuisine a la Card

175542.name: Turds: The Card Game
175542.description:
Turds is a Fun, Strategic, Humoristic and Nasty card game.

Turds is so nasty!! For the first time you really have "Sh#tty Cards" and "This is some bullsh#t!" moments. Be ready for everything, Turds are coming from everywhere!!

How it's played;
Every player has 4 Turds in front and want to get rid of them as quickly as they can.

You can do two things in a turn;
Play and Draw or Discard and Draw from your hand. When you play a card, you fulfill the written action. On the cards you find actions that can destroy, capture, teleport, transfer, disable and more.
The first player to lose his or her turds wins the game!!

There are alot of different cards in one deck (total of 86 cards) and for that reason there are plenty strategic and dirty ways to win the game.

Are you ready for the most nasty and explosive fight of the world!?

175543.description: Sculpted wound tokens for Arcadia Quest game. 60 red plastic 3D hearts.
boardgameaccessory: Arcadia Quest
175543.name: Arcadia Quest: Wound Token Pack

boardgameaccessory: Arcadia Quest
175544.name: Arcadia Quest: Coin Pack

175545.description:
The Nobles is a fast-paced medieval fighting game where you take turns hacking and slashing at each other to see who can strike the killing blow first. Every single strike there's a chance to lose your head, adding a suspenseful life-threatening urgency to every move!

The game is simple. Like in the classic black knight fight scene from Monty Python and the Holy Grail, each player fights until they lose all their limbs, or lose their head. Play cards to fight and confuse your opponent. Roll the dice to charge and retreat. And draw from the bag o' death to see what body part gets cut off.

The Nobles can be played with two players in a one-on-one duel, or with three to four players in a free-for-all death match, or played with teams (2-on-2 or even 3-on-1).

With a mix of strategy and luck, games can average around 20-30 minutes, or can be over in as little as 60 seconds. We've played a lot of games and only once witnessed a killing blow in the first turn, but boy was it satisfying. Boom... head shot!
175545.name: The Nobles
boardgameexpansion: The Nobles: Kickstarter Exclusive – The Ranger

175546.name: The Nobles: Kickstarter Exclusive – The Ranger
175546.description:
The Ranger is a new character the designer decided to add as a bonus for all those people helping to get The Nobles funded on Kickstarter.

She comes with two new playing cards, a new player mat, and of course her game piece. For those who backed at The Lord level, she will come as an upgraded miniature.

175547.name: Silent Legions
175547.description:
From publisher blurb:

The world is broken in hidden ways. The truth is concealed for the sake of mortal minds. The unendurable reality that boils behind the stars is veiled by the pleasant blindness that human sanity requires. Yet every comforting shroud must fall in time, and for these investigators, that time is now.

Silent Legions is a game of modern-day Lovecraftian horror, one carefully designed to support sandbox adventures by hard-bitten investigators and fearless hunters of the dark. Its clean, lightweight old-school rules are compatible with the free Stars Without Number sci-fi game and give both GM and players a steady framework for plumbing the unspeakable secrets of the eldritch night. Now, after a successful Kickstarter with more than 1,100 backers, a Kickstarter completed a month early, this tome of dark secrets can be yours.

Silent Legions isn't just about traditional Yog-Sothothery. Silent Legions is a creation kit, a toolbox in the Sine Nomine style for creating your own Mythos, with all-new deities, alien entities, foul magics, accursed artifacts, unaussprechlichen kulten, and diabolical dream-worlds to bedevil your players. These tools are system-neutral, so even fans of other Lovecraftian gaming systems can scoop them up to add a splash of fresh horror to their more familiar tentacular abominations.

Not only that, but Silent Legions is built to help the GM create investigative adventures with minimal strain. Within these pages you'll find a modular set of templates and adventure guides that help you snap together an evening's intrepid investigation and fit it neatly into your campaign setting. Like the Mythos creation tools, these guides are system-neutral and can be exported for any occasion when you need something wicked to this way come.

So seize now upon this opportunity! Plunder this vault of forgotten lore. Grasp these dark tools of creation and wield their power to fashion your own nightmarish reality. Perhaps none dare name the things that await your animating will, but soon enough the world will know them well….

175549.description:
Accuse and defend your fellow townsfolk as you hunt down the witches of Salem. Act fast, before conspiracy turns you against your own.

The year is 1692, and it is a perilous time to live in the town of Salem, Massachusetts. One wrong step, or one misplaced accusation, and you could be the next witch to hang. "Salem" takes players into this perilous world and lets them re-live the tension, politics, and religious extremism that still has people talking about it 300 years later.

The game is packaged in a faux book box that closes magnetically. The game, disguised as a worn out leather book, can easily hide on your bookshelf and masquerade as an antique.

Players can play as prominent villagers from the old Salem town, and even read their bios in the instruction manual. The servant girl Mary Warren, pastor Samuel Parris, farmer John Proctor, storyteller Tituba, and beggar Sarah Good are some of the 12 characters featured in the game.

Players, each acting as one of these unique characters, are given 3-5 Tryal cards (depending on the number of players). These Tryal cards reveal the true identity of each player, "Witch" or "Not a Witch."

During gameplay, players gather cards that they use to accuse, or defend, other players. Deciding who to trust is key to survival, since you can never play a card on yourself. When you suspect someone to be a witch, you can begin accusing them with red accusation cards. When enough accusations have been placed on one of the players, the player who lays the final accusation chooses one of that player's Tryal cards to reveal. Once all "Witch" Tryal cards have been found, the villagers of Salem win.

Players can also use green and blue cards such as "Alibi", "Stocks", "Matchmaker", "Asylum", and "Scapegoat" to help or hurt their allies or enemies.

As players draw cards, they will eventually draw black cards that take immediate effect. One black card, "Night", forces all players to close their eyes while the Witches choose someone to eliminate, the Constable chooses someone to potentially save, and the Spy chooses a Tryal card to look at. The other black card, "Conspiracy," forces all players to take a face-down Tryal card from the player to their left. Killing witches quickly is essential, otherwise "Conspiracy" may soon have the whole town turned evil.

Before long, accusations will be flying, and screams of "She's a WITCH!" will wake the neighbours. Will you be the hero who purges your town of witches, or will you be wrongly accused and hung for witchcraft? Or perhaps you will be a witch yourself, escape conviction, and bring Salem to the ground.
175549.name: Salem

175550.name: Atlantis: Hero's Guide
175550.description:
Publisher Blurb:

The heroes of the ATLANTIS: The Second Age RPG are evocative and varied and many character combinations exist. The Hero's Guide is designed to help focus and speed up character creation allowing the players and GM alike to make incredible heroes in no time at all.

175551.name: Atlantis: Action Deck
175551.description:
Publisher Blurb:

With the ATLANTIS: The Second Age Action Deck the game master and the players can add another facet to their sword and sorcery adventure games. The cards are play and idea aids to help embellish the action as it happens while making the player heroes more heroic. The Atlantis: Action Deck requires the use of the ATLANTIS: The Second Age Role-playing game

175552.name: Theragraphica
175552.description:
Publisher Blurb:

The Theragraphica is the final companion book for the role-playing game Atlantis: The Second Age. The Theragraphica details the adversaries and creatures that stalk the antediluvian world once ruled by the kingdom of Atlantis. The lavishly illustrated book details creatures of cultural myths from around the world, each keyed to a distinct region to help immerse the players in the world of ATLANTIS. With the Theragraphica, no longer will the heroes battle generic monsters with no cultural grounding.

175553.name: In Translation: The Strange Character Options
175553.description:
Publisher Blurb:

The Cypher System has one of the most graceful and imaginative character generation systems ever brought to roleplaying games. Focus, descriptor, and type create a sentence that elegantly describes your character and lays the mechanical foundation for your abilities. Now players have new options for character generation. In addition to new descriptors and foci, In Translation: The Strange Character Options offers new moves, twists, and revisions, the signature abilities of vector, spinner, and paradox characters. With the game's world-hopping, character-altering setting, The Strange players are always in the market for new character abilities. In Translation: The Strange Character Options gives them what they want!

175554.name: The Strange Character Sheets
175554.description:
Publisher Blurb:

The Strange character sheet is a work of art-and an essential tool for your The Strange campaign. This file contains not just the double-sided, full-color character sheet, but also the recursion sheet and a two-page character generation walkthrough.

175555.name: Ill Omens
175555.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Morden has fallen to the Witches, but their banes continue to prey off of the mortal survivors.

This book of adventures presents a variety of different challenges for Morden's Witchmarked heroes to overcome. New foes are introduced and locations are expanded. The adventures range in scope, with some suited to a single evening's entertainment, while others could encompass several nights of play. Any of them can be interspersed with the Plot Point Campaign included in the Accursed core book.

Accursed: Ill Omens includes works by an all-star cast of gaming writers. Shane Hensley, Rich Baker, Sean Patrick Fannon, and Colin McComb - among others - all contributed to this compilation. Ill Omens includes the PDF adventures The Banshee of Loch Finnere, The Guns of Dagerov, Long Dead and Twice Slain, Half-Light, Absolution, Moon Valley, and Grove Point.

175556.name: Dementalism: Flop, Slop, and Sop
175556.description:
From the publisher:

Things are getting out of control around here. Those wandering clones are still doing their thang, aimlessly meandering about, waiting for you to round them up so you won't get fired or fed to anything. The thing is, now they've entered the burg (some of them, anyway) and they're populating the digs and whatnot. This BRILLIANT expansion to the Dementalism game introduces brand new DIGS cards. These guys alter the very fabric of reality, influencing the way the game is played for everyone. Do you have the NOGGIN to match wits with Oith's greatest dementalists, or should I call your mommy so she can come kiss your boo boos? That's what I thought...

175557.description:
From the publisher:

In Hold Your Breath! each player assumes the role of a pirate treading water in the ocean. These brilliant tacticians have decided to play a game of "Hold Your Breath" to see who is the toughest pirate because, you know, what else are you gooing do in the middle of the ocean facing certain death? The game is played in two rounds. In the first round, each player may dive deeper, providing they have the "Swim" and "Air" cards to do so. Players press their luck each turn since it is the pirate who dives the deepest in round one and resurfaces in round two who is the winner. What about the losers? Who cares, they are losers. But if you really want to know, well, they dove down and ran out of oxygen before they could resurface, so now they are just "resting" underwater until the next game, okay? But we digress... Players can play "Panic", "Shark", and other nasty cards on the other players, slowing their progress. In the second round each player struggles to reach the surface before he runs out of air and therefore decides to take a rest. Most of the pirates may not make it back to the surface, but the one who makes it back alive and dove the deepest is the winner. Be careful, though, because if you dove the deepest in the first round, you will surely have the toughest time getting back to the surface since A) you swam the deepest and B) no one else wants to see you make it back alive. This is a 4 pack bonus card set with manual.
175557.name: Hold your Breath!: Bonus Cards

175558.name: Rotted Capes: Mind Games
175558.description:
Publisher Blurb:

To Know Your Enemy, You Risk Becoming Your Enemy. As the Z-Day struck, what remained of the United States government mobilized to stem the tide, and turned the efforts of its best think tank to the task. Led by Hubert Shand, PhD, M.I.N.D. sought to use the principles of mind control to dominate the Z'd and turn them against each other. He succeeded; but to know evil, one risks becoming evil and when the ingenious device pulled Dr. Shand into madness, Mindwarp was born. The world teeters on the brink of complete domination and only the heroes stand in the way. Mind Games is 32 page adventure providing many nights of peril for even the hardiest band of survivors!

175559.name: Yowza!
175559.description:
From the publisher:

Zap, Zoom, Boom, Bam, Wham... Yowza! You Gotta Say It to Play It in this quick discarding game. Chant along, and if the card you discard matches the word you just chanted, then you get stuck taking the discard pile! If you discard a "wild" card, you get to keep going... but at your own risk! Just be sure you're the first to get rid of all your cards so you can be the winner... Yowza!

175560.name: Hot Tin Roof: Home Turf
boardgamecompilation: Mayfair Games' Limited Edition Promo Expansion Set #16
175560.description:
This is an expansion for Hot Tin Roof. 4 Turf tiles are included that allow the player to claim a patio as their home turf, and whenever another player places a cat on the board from a Home tile on home turf, they must pay that player 1 can.

This expansion contains both the Turf Tiles and cans required for the expansion.

175561.name: Road Rally USA: Mud Boggin'
boardgamecompilation: Mayfair Games' Limited Edition Promo Expansion Set #16
175561.description:
Mud Boggin' is a mini-expansion for Road Rally USA that allows players to place Mud Tiles on the board at start up.

During the game, when a player starts their movement in a space containing a mud tile, the first card they play will give a movement of 1.

175562.description:
Put the ham, cheese and tomato between two slices of bread and the toast will be yours!

Your goal is to have created more toasts than your opponents when the game ends.Using wisely the ingredients you are given, you can delay the other players' toasts and be declared the winner!

The uncompleted toasts are face up in the middle of the table.When it is your turn to play you simply draw the top card of the face down ingredient deck.Then you have to choose in which uncompleted toast the ingredient will go.Every toast needs to consist of two slices of bread, one slice of cheese, ham and tomato. Cheese, ham and tomato have to be placed on top of the first slice of bread.In order to complete the toast you need to place the second slice of bread on top of all these ingredients and you simply take the toast in front of you as a reward!
175562.name: Tostaki

175563.name: Gross-Abulary
175563.description: A word game in which players compete to earn the most picture cards. Players earn points for taking word tiles and grammatically using them correctly in a sentence or phrase. The player earning the most points in a round gets a chance to answer a trivia question on the back of a picture card won. They may tell a joke in the process. At the end of game play, the player with the most picture cards wins.

175564.name: Travelling Goose
175564.description: Roll the die, get through the obstacles and be the player whose goose passes first the finish line!

175565.name: Knowledge Battle
175565.description: Your opponent will ask you questions about a specific issue.You have to answer correctly as many as possible to win and learn!

175566.name: Mario vs. Donkey Kong: Tipping Stars
175566.description:
Get that ‘aha!’ feeling over and over as you guide Minis – toy versions of Nintendo characters - to the exit in each puzzling stage. Tap objects—like bridges and springs—with the stylus to perfect your strategy. You can create, play and share stages online, and use the new tipping system to reward your favorite creators and unlock more content!*

Donkey Kong’s rivalry with Mario™ has reignited in an all-out puzzle challenge! Tackle tricky stages, each filled with clever obstacles: girders, spiked floors, wind-up enemies, warp pipes, conveyer belts and more! You can make your own levels and share your creations online.* As you beat levels, you can earn stars, then cash in those stars to earn new parts for level creation. If you like a level someone built, tip them some stars and they’ll be able to create more imaginative levels using the stars you tipped them! As a bonus, anyone who buys the Wii U version will receive a free download code for the Nintendo 3DS version, and vice versa!**

More than 80 puzzling stages to solve and master
Create your own levels and share them worldwide with others through Miiverse!*
Reward creators who make your favorite levels using the all-new tipping system*
Unlock additional workshop tools using tips received from other players
Share and play levels cross-platform between the Wii U and Nintendo 3DS versions**
Players who buy one version will receive a free download code for the other version!** Learn more >
Earn special stamps to customize your posts in the Miiverse community

Source: The Publisher Website.

175567.name: Triba Nation
175567.description:
Triba Nation is a turn based card game where each player is required to construct a total of five buildings, with the palace as the final building. The first player who builds the palace is recognised as the king and wins the game.

Players start the game with 3 Tribesmen cards. A shared Building Option line of 4 Building cards and a Palace card is setup in the middle of the play area.
Each round then consists 4 phases:

Phase 1 (Draw) - The player draws 2 Tribesmen cards.
Phase 2 (Tribesmen) - The player gets to play Tribesmen cards. A max of 5 Tribesmen can be in the player's area. Players can also swap out Tribesmen during this phase (discarding the one they replaced). Tribesmen are required to build buildings and also activate Attack/Magic cards.
Phase 3 (Construction) - Players can build one Building from the Building Option line if their Tribesmen colors match the Building's requirements. Building special abilities also take place during this phase.
Phase 4 (Action) - Players can play any Attack or Magic cards in hand if they have more Warrior(Attack) or Shaman(Magic) cards than their target. These allow the player to destroy, steal from and generally muck with the targeted opponent.




At the end of the 4th phase, the player trims his hand down to 5 cards and play continues with the next player. The players try to build 4 building and 1 palace (which must be built last). The first player to build the palace wins.

175569.name: Wailing Jhonny
175569.description:
From publisher blurb:

When you hear their shriek, you know you’re being hunted….

Using echolocation, the enormous, bear sized Wailing Jhonny haunts the twisted woodlands and tangled wastes of the new era. People forced to live near these creatures know well enough to stay the hell out of the woods at night, and lock up their families and livestock. Prowling alone or in packs, these mutated bat-like creatures are voracious omnivores which appear in both a standard and wildly mutated variety.

bgaccessoryversion: e-Raptor mini organizer compatible with Eclipse™
175570.description:
from the website

Perfect accessory for Eclipse™ board game. No more trouble with wooden dics and cubes falling of player sheet. Thanks to this tray you will easily keep in order influence tokens and population cubes.

Our tray is solution for players who wants to put everything in the game box.

Dimensions:

Width - 26,6 cm
Lenght - 7 cm
Height - 0,3 cm
Made of high quality clear plexiglass.

No more accidently destroyed player area.
boardgameaccessory: Eclipse
175570.name: Eclipse: e-Raptor mini organizer

175571.name: Desert Tomb 3
175571.description:
From publisher blurb:

The windblown sand and dust of ages hides the Tombs of the Ancient, the graves of Pharaohs, Priests and Queens

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: An Egyptian style tomb complex. Treasures, statues, sarcophagi and floor paintings decorate this ancient burial tomb.

Uses: Steal the treasure from the tomb of the Pharaoh, resurrect the Queen of the Sands, venture into the shadows to destroy an ancient evil.

Also included is a 300dpi full size jpg, for poster printing or VTT.

175572.name: Desert Tomb 2
175572.description:
From publisher blurb:

The windblown sand and dust of ages hides the Tombs of the Ancient, the graves of Pharaohs, Priests and Queens

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: An Egyptian style tomb complex. Treasures, statues, sarcophagi and floor paintings decorate this ancient burial tomb.

Uses: Steal the treasure from the tomb of the Pharaoh, resurrect the Queen of the Sands, venture into the shadows to destroy an ancient evil.

Also included is a 300dpi full size jpg, for poster printing or VTT.

175573.name: Desert Tomb 1
175573.description:
From publisher blurb:

The windblown sand and dust of ages hides the Tombs of the Ancient, the graves of Pharaohs, Priests and Queens

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: An Egyptian style tomb complex. Treasures, statues, sarcophagi and floor paintings decorate this ancient burial tomb.

Uses: Steal the treasure from the tomb of the Pharaoh, resurrect the Queen of the Sands, venture into the shadows to destroy an ancient evil.

Also included is a 300dpi full size jpg, for poster printing or VTT.

175574.name: The Ice Ælves of Niflæheim: Children of the Long Winter
175574.description:
From publisher blurb:

On the high mountains and out on the most chilling, disparate plains, a lost race has just begun to appear on Midgard. Quiet, reserved, and resolute, they are quickly becoming popular as adventuring companions—survivors one and all. These frostbitten warriors and powerful mages are the children of the Endless Winter, souls long thought lost to Midgard—the ice ælves.

175575.name: Witch Hunter
175575.description:
From publisher blurb:

The OSR Witch Hunter is a new class for OSR games meant to emulate the other famous hero from Robert Howard.

Although primarily intended for first advanced edition, it also contains tables for other popular versions: original edition, basic and expert editions, and cyclopedic editions.

175576.name: Vacant Ritual Assembly (Issue 2 - Spring 2015)
175576.description:
From publisher blurb:

Vacant Ritual Assembly is an OSR zine. Directly compatible with Lamentations of the Flame Princess, but easily adaptable to other OSR games. 22-pages of content, 100% of which comes straight from my weekly LotFP campaign.

Issue #2 includes:

Artwork from Ryan Sheffield, Abigail Larson, Anxious P, Sean Poppe, and Xolis.
d66 Name Table: 36 grimdark male given names, 36 grimdark female given names, 36 grimdark family names.
Birthsigns: A d12/zodiac die table to determine your character's birthsign. Includes personality traits and ability score bonus.
Dretcher's Bay: A forlorn fishing village run by three notorious crab captains.
Carcinology: Anachronistic diving suits! Honest-to-god lobstermen and the giant crabs they worship!
The Secrets of Acray: A one-page dungeon of sorts. Features the submerged ruins of Acray, ready to be explored by enterprising player characters.
Oarsmen & Their Woes: Guest article by Anxious P! Mysterious depressives transport desperate PCs through time and space.
With Thine Eye Beheld: A complete one-session adventure featuring the tomb of an ancient cyclops and the disturbed inbred cult who worship there.
Interview with Greg Gorgonmilk: Greg talks Dolmenwood, Drunes, weed, and writing.

rpgitemversion: Premium Calling Cards Onebookshelf POD version
175577.name: Michtim Calling Cards
175577.description:
From publisher blurb:

Handy cards to use while playing Michtim: Fluffy Adventures. Keep all the rules close to the players' hands.

The Premium Calling Cards actually have illustrations on them. The printed Calling Cards include all 12 Callings from the Michtim RPG Core Rulebook: each three times for a total of 36 Calling Cards. The Calling Cards use heavier stock paper, and have all the useful information you need during play. One pack should be enough for the whole game group. If you want to support my game design endeavours, fetch yourself a copy of the DTC cards. Thank you!

The free download doesn't include illustrations and requires some printing and cutting to be useful, but it also includes all the info. Also you can track your bought Calling talents on the cards: just color the emotion icons on the bottom.

175578.name: Spies and Lies (The Inquest)
175578.description:
User summary:

A one-round TOP SECRET/S.I. event for six ICICLE agents.

This is an RPGA tournament module from 1993.

175579.name: Stapel Gekkies
175579.description:
Variant 1:
Everybody takes the cubes in his color.
Make one central pile, everybody puts one cube on the pile. When it falls, you take your cube back. Other cubes stay in the middle.
Then start a new pile.
The first player that has no cubes left this round and gains one point.

Variant 2:
The start player builds a construction with his cubes.
Then the other players try to rebuild this one. The first player to achieve this receives one point.

The game challenges you to invent new variants whith these cubes.

175581.name: The World of the Watershed
175581.description:
From the Introduction:

Erected by the gods, the Watershed divides the lands of men, magic, and evil, protecting each from the others and separating water from Aura from Darkblood.

A thousand years ago, the Sleepstealer, god of evil, invaded the realm of men with his minions, only to suffer defeat by combined forces of humans and Faerine. Ever since, servants of the Darkblood have plotted to return.

Are you one who is destined to stand against them?

175582.name: Secret Service
175582.description:
Some important high-security documents are lost from the Prime Minister's Office. Prime Minister calls hurriedly the Secret Service and asks them to rush and catch the spy the fastest. The spy succeeds to erase his tracks.

Will the Secret Agents be able to surround and catch the spy?A hunt from town to town and from country to country, which takes the breath away from all those involved!

Do you want to be a Spy or a Secret Agent?Choose sides and start the hunting all over Europe until you complete your mission!

In Secret Service, one of the players takes on the role of the Spy. His job is to move from point to point around the map of Europe taking cars, trains, boats or airplanes. The secret agents – that is, the remaining players acting in concert – move around similarly in an effort to move into the same space as the Spy. But while the criminal's mode of transportation is nearly always known, his exact location is only known intermittently throughout the game.

175583.name: Metal Gods of Ur-Hadad (Issue 3 - Spring 2015)
rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
175583.description:
From publisher blurb:

After far too long of a wait, the much-anticipated Metal Gods of Ur-Hadad Issue #3 is here!

In this issue, you'll explore:

A new patron, Atraz A'Zul, the Mother of Spiders!
The various currencies of Ur-Hadad and world beyond!
The Heist! An adventure toolkit designed to let any Judge run a complex robbery on the fly.
"What's that... thing on a stick?" Find out in Street Foods of Ur-Hadad!
A Wayne Snyder Dungeon Insert: The Marrow Web Bridge!

175584.name: Airship Deck
175584.description:
From publisher blurb:

This full color battlemap is the 245th of a series featuring various terrains. This installment of the battlemap series features the deck of a flying ship skimming the clouds.

The map is 28 x 30 squares in size, with each 1 inch square scaled to represent 5 feet. It is provided in 12 segments, which need to be assembled, in a single PDF using the letter format.

The product has been updated to include a large gridless JPG image of the map, intended for use with VTT software. It is 4032x4320 pixels in size at 144dpi.

175585.name: OneDice WW1
175585.description:
From publisher blurb:

Quick and easy role-playing rules for the Great War

OneDice WW1 is a role-playing game set against the backdrop of the Great War of 1914-18. A global conflict, costing millions of lives, the war involved the mobilisation and shattering of the mightiest of armies ever assembled. It was fought on a previously unimaginable industrial scale. Whether you want to play as one of the front-line combatants in the mighty conflict or as a civilian, spy, medic or journalist, all the rules you need are in this book.

There are additional “skins” for adding Occultish Horror and Endless War twists to the world, along with a bunch of adventure seeds to get you started playing quickly.
Whether an enthusiastic recruit, a jaded veteran, or a non-combatant on a special mission – it’s time to enter the grim and dangerous world of OneDice WW1.

175586.name: Magical Legend: Demons
175586.description:
This is the first game in the Magical Legend series of games. The game is set in a mythical Chinese world like that of the Chinese classic "Investiture of the Gods". The game world is further fleshed out in other Magical Legend comics and novels.

There are 2 game modes.

Game Mode 1 (Deities vs Demons):
Gameplay-wise this is similar to Bang. There are 3 roles (Deity, Demons, Spirits). The Deity wins if he kills all Demons and non-subjugated Spirits. The Demons win if they kill the Deity. The Spirits win if they kill the Deity and 1 Demon or 1 Spirit who has killed a Demon. The Deity has 3 power up cards which he can offer as a reward to subjugate(ie. ally) a Spirit. Spirits can renege on the alliance/subjugation but will suffer penalties for doing so. The game replaces the suits (Heart, Spades, etc) of Bang with a 5-element system (Metal, Wood, Water, Fire, Earth) and characters, abilities and card actions vary depending on the elements involved. There is no concept of Distance and no Missed cards. Attacks succeed or are countered based on the elements. Card actions often require Magic points to power them. Otherwise the gameplay is quite similar.

Game Mode 2 (Faction Battles):
This mode can only be played with an even number of players (4-10). Players split into 2 camps and a representative from each camp draw 1 of 5 faction cards to see what faction they are. Factions have specific powers which can be triggered to allow cooperation between members of the faction. There are no hidden roles in this mode and all players of a faction win if the other faction is eliminated. Other aspects of gameplay (ie. drawing, attacking, etc) are similar to game mode 1.

175587.name: Shadow of the Demon Lord Starter Guide
175587.description:
UNRELEASED GAME




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it unless given direct written permission from the publisher which must be noted in the image caption.




From publisher blurbL

The STARTER GUIDE is about 36 pages long and includes rules for creating starting characters and the game's rules. Print it and hand it to your players to help them make starting characters.

175588.name: Shadow of the Demon Lord Core Rulebook
175588.description:
From publisher blurb:

278 page rulebook that contains everything you need to play Shadow of the Demon Lord

175589.name: Tales of the Demon Lord
175589.description:
From publisher blurb:

The End Starts Here

The signs are everywhere. The mad prophets shriek dire warnings on the streets of Crossings, while strange monsters roam the lands beyond the city’s walls. Strange cults flourish in the lawless wilds, while the undead muster in the desert wastes to the north. The end is near, but is it too late to stop it?

Tales of the Demon Lord presents eleven adventures set in the lands of the Northern Reach, the far-flung province of a dying empire. Game Masters can run the adventures as a complete campaign, taking starting characters to the heights of their master paths, or use them individually to tell a different story. In addition to the adventures, this sourcebook contains detailed information about the city of Crossings and a selection of new creatures to terrorize the Northern Reach and beyond.

175590.name: X-Wind
175590.description:
Players in this game compete to be the first to collect the 6 cards depicting the 6 pieces of the Armor of God. The first person to collect all 6 cards and discard all other cards from his hand wins.

The players start with 3 cards each. On their turn, they draw a card from the draw pile and decide to either keep the card or play it. The rules do not mention a hand limit but logically a hand limit of 6 should be applied. Otherwise there is no way to win the game.

Cards can be pieces of the Armor of God, or action cards. Action cards include :

Drop 1 and Reverse - the targeted player needs to discard 1 piece of the Armor of God failing which they will miss a turn. Then the direction of play is reversed.
Drop 2 and Reverse - Similar to Drop 1 and Reverse except 2 cards need to be discarded.
Jumper - This card can be played at any time and takes precedence over all other cards. Play jumps back to the player who played the card.
Skip - This skips the next player's turn.
Little Angel - This counters the Drop 1 and 2 cards.

175591.description:
Description from the publisher:

Just when you had that bear attack under control, things got all Trail Mix'd! See if you can adapt as the game changes with each roll of the die!

Before each round of Bears!, the expansion die is rolled and a new rule is in effect. One round you're scoring double for Runners, the next your rerolls are limited — or maybe you're trying for bonus points by shooting the most bears.

Think fast and roll even faster in this ever-changing expansion to Bears!
175591.name: Bears! Trail Mix'd

175592.name: The Village Crone
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 107-- Gen Con 2015 Wrap up and La Granja Review
Episode 15: Survive: Escape from Atlantis!, Trading Places, and Cardinal Quest
175592.description:
Description from the publisher:

Become a witch and enter the medieval world of Wickersby in this worker placement, resource management game with spellcasting! Make villagers fall in love, turn them into frogs, or teleport them to different locations. Use your familiars to gather ingredients and cast spells on the villagers to achieve goals and score victory points as you vie to be named the village crone.

All the players are witches who have come upon a medieval village without a crone. They send out familiars to gather ingredients they can use in spells to complete Witch's Scheme cards. Each of the cards is worth 1, 2, or 3 points, which also indicates how difficult the scheme is to complete. The witch who scores 13 points wins.

The village consists of 6 location game boards: village green, lord's manor, farm, mill, forge, and tithe barn. The locations are modular and can be placed in any order or configuration as long as the gridlines line up. (The easiest way to play is with a 3x2 retangular configuration.)

The villagers, who are the most frequent targets of the Witch's Schemes, have starting locations. The peasant begins in the village green, the lord in the lord's manor, the farmer in the farm, the miller in the mill, the blacksmith in the forge, and the priest in the tithe barn.

The ingredients can be found at 4 of the 6 locations. Silver is in the lord's manor, soil in the farm, flour in the mill, and fire in the forge. There are also 3 eye of newt cards in each stack of ingredients and can be used as wild cards in spells.

At the beginning of the game, each player is dealt 1 of each of the 3 levels of Witch's Scheme cards. Consulting their Books of Spells (which are the same for each witch) to determine which ingredients will be needed to cast the spells on their Witch's Scheme cards, they put 1 familiar in the village green, take turns placing 2 additional familiars in other locations, and draw 2 ingredients from those locations.

The first step in the order of play is to tithe. As soon as each player knows which ingredient they will sacrifice, they place it facedown in the tithe barn. This seeds the tithe barn with ingredients that can be gleaned with the Fortune spell (which allows a player to draw any 3 ingredients from the tithe barn). However, any player who placed a familiar in the tithe barn does not have to tithe.

Then, in turn order, players may move their own familiars and/or villagers and cast spells. (Spells may be cast for strategic or tactical purposes as well as to complete Witch's Schemes.) The movement is limited to a total of 6 spaces, and the number of spells is limited only by the ingredients the player has. The movement and spellcasting can be in any order on a player's turn. A player can even intersperse movement and spellcasting. If a player completes a Witch's Scheme, the card is turned over so that the other players can clearly see how many points that player has. After he/she is finished moving and casting spells, he/she draws 1 of each of the 3 levels of cards, reads them, and decides which one(s) to add to his/her hand as replacements.

When all players have finished moving and casting spells, the players harvest 2 ingredients for each familiar in a location, and the broom (which indicates the first player) is moved clockwise.

The spells are Conjuring (to add up to 2 more familiars into play), Love (to join the fates of 2 villagers, meaning spells cast on one affect the other and movement of one moves the other), Transformation (to turn a villager into a frog or vice versa), Binding (to lock a location down and prevent anyone or anything from entering or leaving a location), Switching (to change the place of 2 familiars and/or villagers), Summoning (to cause a villager to move to a location containing one of the player's familiars), Fortune (to allow a player to draw any 3 ingredients from the tithe barn), and Protection (to block a spell cast by another player). 1 silver can also be used to complete a Scheme out of turn or to discard and draw a new Witch's Scheme card. Each spell requires not only ingredients but also an incantation, which is provided in the Book of Spells. Alternatively, players can make up their own incantations. If a player is caught trying to complete a spell without speaking the incantation, the spell does not work.

Each witch has access to the same number of starting familiars, the same ingredients, the same spells, and 3 Schemes of the same level. But the witch who most cleverly uses these resources to reach 13 points is named the village crone.

The Village Crone also includes rules for solitaire play.

175593.name: Whirly's World
175593.description: Glide along the trail rolling dice, completing odd & even cards & gathering Whirly tokens. The first snail to join Whirly in the center of the garden wins the game!

175594.name: Komm, wir ziehen nach Bethlehem!
175594.description:
A Christmas-themed racing game for children.

The four (yes, four!) wooden Magi are placed on a table or on the floor, about a meter from the pieces representing Mary, Joseph and baby Jesus. At the start of the game, each player is secretly assigned a color, and to win he/she has to be the first to move the wise man of the corresponding colour to the Holy Family. Movement is decided by rolling a die and moving a king the length of a wooden camel piece. Players can move their own wise man as well as those of other players. Give your colour away too soon and you risk that the other players move you back!

175595.description:
A murder mystery dinner-style party game in which each player is assigned a role and players try to find out who the murderer is. Each player has his/her own information booklet, and five game rounds are spent discussing clues and inconsistencies until players vote on who to accuse of the murder.

The setting for this case is downtown Manhattan, 1981. The members of the Assassino clan are having a meeting at Ristorante Assassino when Vico, son and right hand of Don Assassino is found murdered at the lavatory.
175595.name: Ristorante Assassino

175596.name: Medieval Camp
175596.description:
From publisher blurb:

This Product is a 40 x 40 inch, full color battlemap of a Medieval Camp.

The Product comes with the Square, Hex and No Overlay versions and the Virtual Tabletop Maps (VTT) and include a 360 degree view of the inside of the Medieval Camp.

“Well let’s see if this batch of pages has what it takes to be squires or knights someday.”—Knight Training Instructor

Medieval Camp is a single map of a small training camp surrounded by a wooden palisade with four corner towers. Medieval Camp includes a 360-degree panoramic view from the center of the map.

Medieval Camp is intended for use in fantasy or medieval games. Medieval Camp can be an excellent training base for starting Player Characters.

Adventure hook for use with this map:

Trial by Fire: By day the pages train in the courtyard with weapon, armor, and shield training and horse riding. At night they stay up and guard the towers with the night watch, learning how to remain awake even when exhausted after a long day of combat.

A rival noble sends his knights to attack the medieval camp as part of an all-out attack on his rival’s fiefdom in a takeover bid. They set fire to the palisade and the young pages are forced to fight in real combat for the first time. Adult Players can take the part of the Knight Training Instructors with Kid Players taking the part of the young pages. Goals are to put out the fires and to defeat the rival knights.

175597.description:
A murder mystery dinner-style party game in which each player is assigned a role and players try to find out who the murderer is. Each player has his/her own information booklet, and five game rounds are spent discussing clues and inconsistencies until players vote on who to accuse of the murder.

This case takes place at an almost deserted college campus during the Christmas holidays. All remaining inhabitants of the campus have been invited to a Christmas dinner, but the last guest arrives with horrible news: Stewart White, janitor, has been found murdered in his room, and the killer is among the guests.
Roles include the campus cop, a football player, a cheerleader and an exchange student.
175597.name: American XMAS Dinner

175598.name: Witch Girls Adventures: Respelled
175598.description:
From publisher blurb:

Witch Girls adventures is back and better than ever! With new rules, more powerful Cliques and awesome new magic and abilities the original dram-Diaries game receives an upgrade with Witch Girls: Respelled. So Dust off your Witch Girls Rule books, gather your friends and get ready to enter a magical world once again.

175599.name: The Official Guide to Coventry School For Girls
175599.description:
From publisher blurb:

On the hidden Isle of Avalon sits the most prestigious of all magical schools. Coventry only takes the best and the brightest and witch’s around he world compete every year to just be placed on the waiting list to this legendary arcane academy. The guide to Coventry School for Girls brings the very first school of magic to vivid life for Witch Girls Adventures Stars and Directors. Included is not only a new school but new teachers, abilities, students and more.

175600.name: Annabelle DeVille's Guide to Mystical Mayhem: Wicked Ways
175600.description:
From publisher blurb:

WICKEDNESS IS ITS OWN REWARD! Annabelle Deville isn’t the kind of witch that saves mortals, turns the other cheek and helps save kittens in trees. She’s the kind that wants to be feared, turn people into toads and sees mortals at best as slow witted pets. For the Star wanting to walk on the dark side or the director wanting more malicious and well rounded foes for her games “Wicked Ways” offers new Cliques, abilities, skills and more for the WITCH GIRL ADVENTURES DRAMA DICE GAME!

175601.description:
A murder mystery dinner-style party game in which each player is assigned a role and players try to find out who the murderer is. Each player has his/her own information booklet, and five game rounds are spent discussing clues and inconsistencies until players vote on who to accuse of the murder.

This case is set in the Berlin of the golden 20s. The producer of a silent movie is hosting a press dinner behind the scenes to present the newest star actress, Marlies Reinhold, to the public. Celebrities and press representatives are waiting for Marlies' entrance when the host appears alone, reporting he has just found Marlies murdered. Since the set had been closed to anyone but the people present at the dinner all day long, one thing is certain: The killer is among those present.
175601.name: Der Fall Marlies Reinhold

175602.description:
A murder mystery dinner-style party game in which each player is assigned a role and players try to find out who the murderer is. Each player has his/her own information booklet, and five game rounds are spent discussing clues and inconsistencies until players vote on who to accuse of the murder.

Cognac, France, in 1938: The ladies and gentlemen have left the property for the weekend. The remaining employees are jumping at the chance to have a pompous dinner. Butler, cook, assistant cook, gardener, chambermaid and nanny - everyone is preparing for the occasion when a murder is discovered and the killer has to be found.
175602.name: Le diner mortel

175603.description:
A murder mystery dinner-style party game in which each player is assigned a role and players try to find out who the murderer is. Each player has his/her own information booklet, and five game rounds are spent discussing clues and inconsistencies until players vote on who to accuse of the murder.

This case offers a cast of 8 particularly bizarre characters, among them a power-hungry conductor, an extreme eco-terrorist, a genius inventor, an old lady suffering from actinic dermatitis and a man in a kangaroo costume. The 8 craziest gangsters of the world have met to capture their common arch-enemy Major Sunshine, whose secrets would grant them world dominance. But then a bomb goes off in the cell in which the Major is kept, and now they have to find out who betrayed their alliance and killed the Major.
175603.name: Die Allianz der Unterwelt

175605.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Tired of hunting for a specific table in a rulebook? Wish you had heavy-duty reference cards for Strategic Operations game play like that found in the 25th Anniversary Introductory Box Set? Then the Strategic Kit is for you! The Strategic Kit contains five heavy-duty cards of compiled tables from Strategic Operations. Strategic Operations is required to use the Strategic Kit (compiled tables reflect corrected second printing).
boardgameaccessory: Classic Battletech: Strategic Operations
175605.name: Classic Battletech: Strategic Kit

175608.name: Speedy Recall: Double Take!
175608.description:
From the pulbisher:

If you like Speedy Recall you'll LOVE Speedy Recall Double-Take! Take the extra challenge to give your funny bone a boost! Flip over a category card and a letter but wait... DOUBLE TAKE! Your answer has to start with "G" and it must also consider the Double-Take card! Easy? Maybe if everyone else wasn't also trying to come up with an answer at the same time. The giggles quickly turn to hoots and hollers when Speedy Recall-Double Take is on the table!

175609.name: Iron Gods
175609.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Otherworldly Riches! Futuristic weapons, mysterious malfunctioning super-tech, and even alien parasites are all found in this trove of treasures for use in your Iron Gods campaign. Each of this set's 54 beautifully illustrated, full-color cards includes space on the back for players to add notes on their loot. These Pathfinder Item Cards are designed for use with the Iron Gods Adventure Path, but are compatible with any fantasy roleplaying game.

175610.name: Tech Deck
175610.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Super-Science! Strange helmets and armor, futuristic medical technology, and weapons unlike any in the known world all appear in this trove of treasures for use in your science fantasy or science fiction campaign. Each of this set's 54 beautifully illustrated, full-color cards includes space on the back for players to add notes on their loot. These Pathfinder Item Cards are designed for use with the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game, but are compatible with any fantasy roleplaying game. Pathfinder Item Cards allow heroes to keep track of their equipment in style. Each full-color card features a beautiful portrait of an item on one side with blank space on the back to keep notes. These Pathfinder Item Cards are designed for use with the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game, but are compatible with any fantasy or science fiction roleplaying game.

175611.name: Numenera Dice Set
175611.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Numenera Dice Set (4) is official dice set for Monte Cook Games' Numenera RPG system, featuring 1x D6, 1x D10, 1x D100 (percentile) and 1x D20 in a box.

175612.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Warmachine dice set for Cygnar faction, produced together with Privateer Press. The only one original! Each faction-themed set of six premium six-sided dice includes five dice featuring faction colors and iconography and one WARMACHINE die designed for AOE deviation and damage location rolls.
boardgameaccessory: Forces of Warmachine: Cygnar
175612.name: Warmachine: Cygnar Faction Dice

175613.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Warmachine dice set for Cryx faction, produced together with Privateer Press. The only one original! Each faction-themed set of six premium six-sided dice includes five dice featuring faction colors and iconography and one WARMACHINE die designed for AOE deviation and damage location rolls.
boardgameaccessory: Forces of Warmachine: Cryx
175613.name: Warmachine: Cryx Faction Dice

175614.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Warmachine dice set for The Protectorate of Menoth faction, produced together with Privateer Press. The only one original! Each faction-themed set of six premium six-sided dice includes five dice featuring faction colors and iconography and one WARMACHINE die designed for AOE deviation and damage location rolls.
boardgameaccessory: Forces of Warmachine: Protectorate of Menoth
175614.name: Warmachine: Protectorate of Menoth Faction Dice

175615.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Warmachine dice set for Retribution of Scyrah faction, produced together with Privateer Press. The only one original! Each faction-themed set of six premium six-sided dice includes five dice featuring faction colors and iconography and one WARMACHINE die designed for AOE deviation and damage location rolls.
boardgameaccessory: Forces of Warmachine: Retribution of Scyrah
175615.name: Warmachine: Retribution of Scyrah Faction Dice

175616.name: Play-Doh: Alle auf Kalle
175616.description:
Each player forms 10 little marbles from one of the 3 containers of play-doh that come with the game. Then Kalle, a can that opens and closes its lid and moves its arms while rotating at the center of three catapults, is activated. The players try to shoot their marbles into the can with the catapults. The first player to get in three marbles wins the game.

(The bases of the catapult also contain some molds for sculpting play-doh.)

175617.description:
From the publisher:

From the cold region of the Northern Mountains, comes a man with tremendous strength and fortitude. He has heard the call for adventure, and answered it, with attitude! The Barbarian is a tough Hero that adds new strategy and options to the game. This Expansion adds an additional Character to the game and can be played with 5 players.
175617.name: Dungeon Dwellers: Barbarian Expansion

175618.name: East Texas University: GM Screen with Class Ring
175618.description:
