boardgamepodcastepisode: The Polyhedron Collider Cast - UK Games Expo 2016
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 22!!!
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 23!!!

175731.name: Dragonhearth
175731.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Grand Stair stretches behind the scenes of the multiverse,
The Doors upon its unfathomably vast span leading the way to gossamer worlds of limitless variety and infinite possibility. Here, there be dragons.

Dragonhearth is full of dragons, dragons, dragons – faerie dragons, drakes, wyverns, feathered serpents, dragon-men, dracoliches, dragons whose breath makes up the clouds in the sky and whose bones form the bedrock of mountains. Seek the spiritual connection of a dragonbond, and bind yourself eternally to a winged beauty through an eternity of reincarnation and blessed metamorphosis. But all is not well in the land of dragons, for a technological terror has returned from alien realms afar, and a corruption of heartless circuits seeks to leash the hearts of these untamable beasts. The battle for the soul of Dragonhearth has begun.

175732.name: Universal Adventures Adventure Module DK1: Death Fog
175732.description:
From publisher blurb:

The road to adventure had left you in the wilds for many days. Now, short on rations and in need of a good rest under a roof, the signs of a settlement are a welcome sight. As you pass the recently sown fields and draw closer to the village, there are signs that all is not well. Doors hang askew, shutters bang in the breeze, but of the inhabitants there is no sight nor sound.

The bell that cannot ring, that must not ring, has tolled its deathly knell and the world of the living now belongs to the dead.

The Death Knell Apocalypse has begun! Can your characters survive the undead apocalypse?

Death Fog is the first adventure in the new Death Knell Apocalypse campaign. The module includes introductory and setup information, an Adventure Record with background, start and objective information, 9 Adventure cards, 9 Encounter cards, 9 Event cards, 9 Search cards, 18 Treasure cards and 9 Great Hall cards. Suitable for use with any fantasy role playing game, Death Fog can be played solo or with a group, with or without a GM. The adventure is highly re-playable and compatible with other Universal Adventures cards. In addition, you can combine the cards with other cards from the series, or cards from other Universal Adventures products, to create your own adventures.

Like the Adventure Modules in the Universal Adventures line, this adventure is a new, simple way to play fantasy adventures. The organization and presentation of the adventures allows for quick setup, quick play and gives you the ability to focus on the action and “story” while leaving you the option to include tactical action and combat if you desire. Enter a new and deadly world of adventure. Gather your heroes and try to survive the Death Knell Apocalypse beginning with Death Fog.

175733.name: Magical Characters
175733.description:
From publisher blurb:

Take Your Game To The Next Level!

Introducing “Alternate Paths: Martial Characters”. This book is designed with the very experienced player in mind as it presents alternate rules and classes that are more suited to their needs.
Overview: 7 new base classes, non-vancian magic systems, 8 new armor properties, 20 new weapon properties, 3 unique magic items, 34 new feats (16 of those are metamagic/non-class specific magic manipulating feats), 10 revised feats and talents, 17 new spells (very much focused on the meta-game of magic), 10 new magical diseases and afflictions.!

Base Classes:

Ancient: A ritualistic spellcaster who welcomes the host of all their past lives into their soul. They have a small, unique, spell list that provides 24 hour buffs (rituals) that require the receiving party to partake in the casting. They tap deep into the memory of eons long past to control this primal form of magic. The class also plays with age categories and time in a very weird fashion. (Non-vancian)
Arcanaphage: They turn a particularly nasty magical disease into raw magical power. They are part magical hacker (modifying their spells on the fly with impromptu adjustments), part antimage, and part blaster.
Gnostic: A mathematical mage with multitude of multiplying effects on their magic. They practice a form of divine numerology to power their spells and modify their all-AoE spell list based on how many creatures they target. They have a small list of about a dozen spells that all have variable spell levels and are based on a fluctuating resource rather than a vancian system.
Godaiken: If you have played our "tao" this is it's elemental brother. Using a visual chart- you can master the elements and perform crazy displays of martial power.
Haunted One: A haunted one turns a ghost that just won't leave you alone into a power. Their ghastly companion is deadly but not always under your control. They also have suite of ghost themed abilities that is more "6th Sense" than "necromancer".
Lover: By denying themselves love, a lover gains supernatural magical power. They are trained diplomats and peacekeepers, using their abilities to snuff the flames of war. They are masters of debilitating magic- able to drain or subdue creatures with either their diplomacy or their magic.
Worldshaper: A worldshaper is a magical artisan who is part of a masonic guild (though not as covert). They have the ability to manipulate materials like clay, animate objects (our playtest had a house try to coup de grace a t-rex), while still remaining a viable character. Our playtesters described it as a utility heavy toolbox that is only as strong as your creativity!

175734.name: Turkey My Mayonnaise
175734.description:
Have you ever built your dream sandwich? Imagine doing that and having a great card game too! Introducing Turkey My Mayonnaise, the hottest new card game on the market!

The object is simple. Be the first to complete sandwich recipes... any way you can. See a piece of cheese on someone's sandwich you like? Take it with a "Steal" card. Pepperocinis in the discard pile? Time for a dumpster dive! Sandwich combinations are virtually endless so the game is unique every time!

A set collection and building game.

175735.name: Rocca Town
175735.description:
Rocca Town is a hexagon-shaped card game designed to look like a cube. Connect houses with same colored roofs.

On a player's turn, they can play a card that connects to a similar colored roof card on the table. Alternatively, if they are not able to do that action, they draw a card. If they can play that card they do so, otherwise turn goes to the next player.

The arrows on the house cards determine the direction the houses have to be played.

A card with an arrow pointing up, allows for purple "level" cards to be played on top of it. Making the house into a tower. If a house/tower with several levels is topped with a big roof card. The next player has to draw cards equal to the number of levels the tower has.

Cards with a cat on the roof allow you to play another card of the same roof color.

Playing a "Trulie" card allows you to roll the dice to see what happens. This can be both good or bad for you.

The first player to empty their hand of cards wins the game.

175737.description: Black Sinister is a special set of the 109 Waffen SS pieces from Sinister Forces, in the same black color scheme as those in the Black SS scenario book.
boardgameaccessory: Panzer Grenadier: Sinister Forces
175737.name: Panzer Grenadier: Black Sinister

175738.description:
From the Avalanche Press website:

Finland’s lone armored division entered service in the summer of 1943, created by combining the existing Tank Brigade with the elite 1st Jäger Brigade. The division remained in reserve until the summer of 1944, when a massive Soviet offensive threatened to overwhelm Finnish defenses. Led by Maj. Gen. Ruben Lagus, the Armored Division, known as the Marshal’s Fist (Marskin Nyrkki) entered the fighting around Tali on the Karelian Isthmus. Most of its tanks were small, obsolete T26 models captured from the Soviets and totally outclassed by the modern T34/85’s of the Red Army. Despite fanatical bravery, the Marshal’s Fist could not stop the enemy onslaught.

The Marshal’s Fist is a set of 165 pieces for the Panzer Grenadier game system, showing the entire division as it stood in the summer of 1944. At that time the division included:

• Three truck-mounted Jäger (light infantry) battalions. Each includes nine Jäger platoons, three HMG platoons and one 81mm mortar platoon in game terms, and 13 trucks to carry them.
• One anti-tank battalion, shown by six 50mm and three 75mm anti-tank guns, pulled by six trucks and three KMS prime movers.
• Two tank battalions, together represented by 16 T26s tanks, one KV1 at reduced strength, two Sotkas and one T28 at reduced strength. Each tank battalion also included a small detachment of armored cars.
• Two light artillery battalions, each with three 105mm artillery units and three KMS prime movers, and one medium battalion of three 150mm batteries, pulled by three KMS prime movers.
• An armored signal company with one T37, a separate assault gun company with three BT42’s, a motorcycle company, an engineer battalion with nine ENG platoons and an assault gun battalion with seven Stu40 platoons.

The set includes some extra pieces, like the 50mm anti-tank guns that preceded the 75mm pieces, and the Sotka (T34) and PzKwIVJ tanks that Marshal Carl Gustav Emil Mannerheim, Finland’s commander-in-chief and the division’s namesake, unsuccessfully tried to purchase from Germany. The division becomes far more powerful with these vehicles in place of its hopeless T26 tanks.

Send your Finnish armor clanking into battle!
boardgameaccessory: Panzer Grenadier: Arctic Front
Panzer Grenadier: Arctic Front Deluxe Edition
175738.name: Panzer Grenadier: The Marshall's Fist

175739.name: Disney Pictopia
175739.description:
The Ultimate Picture-Trivia family Game!

Make family game time magical!

Discover playful trivia spanning decades of Disney magic, from animated classics and blockbuster movies to television hits and dazzling theme park destinations. It's a game of teamwork - with a competitive twist! Along the way are guess-my-answer qustios that reveal how much you know about the other players!

175740.description:
Zeppelin Attack!: Robotic Promo Packet contains five "promo" cards for your Zeppelin Attack! game.

- Edison's Atomic Robot (Attack)
- Tesla's Atomic Robot (Defense)
- Man with a Plan (Operative)
- No Rest For The Wicked (Fate)
- The Invizeppelin (Zeppelin)
175740.name: Zeppelin Attack!: Robotic Promo Packet

175741.name: Power Legion
175741.description:
Power Legion is a fast-playing tabletop wargame ruleset. Each player controls a team of heroes or villains, each with their own attributes, traits, and tricks.
Create any hero from comics, animation or film with a flexible point-based system. Use 3 to 5 figures per side or play larger games. Playable on a 3'x3' table using any figures you already own.

175742.description:
Alien Wars is a fast, card-tossing game in which your goal is to become Master of the Galaxy, and to do this you need to eliminate everyone else from the galaxy. Then you can do whatever you want with the place.

To set up, place the three Nano Minefield cards face down about ten inches apart. Then each player simultaneously places their nine cards face down in the playing area, keeping space between all other cards, while also packing them in as tightly as possible.

On a turn, you choose one card in play and reveal it. If it's...


A Nano Minefield, flip it face down again.
A player's card, that player takes the action on the card with the possible actions being:



Planet: Return one of your eliminated non-planet cards to play.
Scanner: Look at three face-down cards, then remove the scanner from play.
Blaster: Shoot once.
Double Blaster: Shoot twice.
Retro Blaster: Shoot once; also, if this is card is eliminated, shoot once before removing it from play.



To shoot, you place your pinky on the active card, then toss your shooting disc with your thumb and forefinger. When the disc lands, you can remove one card it touches from play, revealing it and returning it to its owner. If a player has no cards in play, they're out of the game. The final player with cards in play wins!
175742.name: Alien Wars
boardgamepodcastepisode: Cult of the New Board Game Podcast 004 – Essen 2015 Diary!

175743.name: Aurelian
175743.description:
Aurelian is a tabletop game about the Crisis of the Third Century, the period during which the Roman empire nearly disintegrated in constant civil war and foreign invasions.

Players take one of four roles: a Roman, Germanic, Sarmatian, or Persian commander. Any number of players can conduct a campaign, in which each type of army has a different set of victory conditions. While holding off Rome's many enemies, the Roman players are also trying to defeat each other and ultimately become (and remain!) emperor.

The Persians are trying to carve away provinces in the east and add them to the Sassanian monarchy. The barbarians are trying to raid and carry away as much loot as possible while amassing glory from victorious battles over any sort of enemy, even one's own tribe. Every battle is therefore a balancing act, in which the military and political context is constantly shifting.
Aurelian can be played with miniatures, or with "unit tiles" on any flat surface, much in the same manner as Blücher's unit cards. The centerpiece of the game is the campaign, in which each player manages the fortunes of his character and faction, much in the manner of the campaigns in Maurice and Longstreet.
Unlike most Ancients games, which attempt to span the millennia from Moses to Columbus, Aurelian concentrates on a specific period of roughly 70 years. Players fight a series of nine battles against a variety of enemies, often from one's own side. The composition of their armies changes. Veteran Roman legionaries become incresingly scarce and irreplaceable as the Roman players cobble together vexillations and recruit barbarian foedorati and tributarii. Will the Persians squander their expensive elite cataphracts and elephant units in early battles, or hold them in reserve? Will a barbarian warlord play it safe and not raid as deeply into the empire, at the risk of not bringing back enough treasure and glory to maintain the loyalty of his optimates?

175744.description:
The Hundred Days is a boxed set of 216 richly colourful heavy-duty poker-sized cards, providing all the units of the three armies (French, Prussian and Anglo-Allied) in the 1815 campaign, as well as cards for famous personalities, objectives, and other useful things.

It includes many units that never fought in the battles but could have.

These cards substitute for miniatures and allow the player to field three large armies and play a full campaign.

This is an expansion set for Blücher. You must have a copy of the Blücher rulebook in order to use this product.
boardgameaccessory: Blucher
175744.name: The Hundred Days (Blucher Unit Cards)

175745.name: Lemons
175745.description:
When life gives you Lemons... make lemonade!

Lemons is a card game where each Lemon card is played in front of a player and it counts as a minus point, but if a player gathers 3 matching Lemon cards he makes Lemonade and the 3 negative points become 1 positive point. So keep an eye on his Lemon stacks and make sure you don't play a 3rd card of the same type.

Each type of Lemon card in front of a player allows that player to play cards on his/her turn in a particular way. Which can be to his left or right, straight across or on his own stacks. On a player's turn he/she must choose one of the Lemon card stacks in front of him/herself and play cards as allowed by that card.

To add a bit of suspense, when a player legally chooses to play a card in front of themself, it may be placed face down in their secret stash. When the game ends, these cards are added to the face up stacks, so you might not know how many pitchers of Lemonade have been made by a player until it's time to... drink up.

175747.name: Tavern Tales
175747.description:
from the webpage

Tavern Tales is a fantasy-themed tabletop roleplaying game. What makes Tavern Tales different? Every aspect of Tavern Tales follows these fundamental design principles:

Stay simple, intuitive, and tactical. There's a fine line between too complicated and too simple, and Tavern Tales strives for that balance. The rules are fairly easy to pick up, but they also allow for depth of strategy.
Emphasize customization. Tavern Tales gives players ultimate freedom in building their characters. You'll never be stuck with a single play style because you picked a certain class or race. Play whatever character you want, however you want!
Enable well-rounded characters. Combat is just one aspect of a roleplaying game—there's also exploration and interaction. Your character in Tavern Tales will have interesting options in all three of these categories.
Think cinematically, not mathematically. Tavern Tales emphasizes exciting, cinematic gameplay.
Grow. Tavern Tales will never stop growing! The game will feature frequent updates with new themes, magic items, monsters, and content!
Remain free to play. You'll never need to spend a penny on Tavern Tales!

175748.name: Vuelo 747
175748.description:
Vuelo 747 ("Flight 747") is a game about traveling the world, Flight aboard the worldwide famous Jumbo 747 Airplaine;, each player begins with an amount of money and takes its turn by spining the airplaine, placing the flag and taking the country card landed if its the first arrived or paying to the country card location owner the amount of the fee.

Like a fast monopoly version where you win by having more money at the end, or by eliminating other players before the last country is taken.

Good way for teaching kids (and late kids) about countries flags, currency and several 70s facts.

175749.name: Campaign Chunks Volume Five
175749.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Campaign Chunk is an item, place or something else that can fit into any campaign or story with little or no modification, although some will be more suited to certain genres than others.

They have no stats and can help provide starting grounds for adventures or help fill in the gaps when your players go off exploring and you need something for them to do. Each have several hooks or rumour that can be used. Which of these are true and which are false?

Originally first published on the blog/website of Ennead Games, some of these Chunks have been compiled into a handy volume. Their details may have been cleaned up and more hooks or rumours added to them, but they basically the same.

Inside you'll find :-

Ankh of Tiumautef - Cross like object used to symbolise life
“Demon Blood” Arrow - An arrow with an unseual property
Funerary Mask - Mask worn by the dead
Highbourne Observatory - An observatory built by an industrialist
Lanterns of Landium - 14 lanterns rumoured to run on a nasty fuel
Lost Automata of DeMerch - A clockwork item some say is cursed
Lost Book of prophecy - A book of of propercys that have a rather precise end date
Mobius-Strip Roller Coaster - A highly configurable rollercoaster is now open for riders
Niavon Numbers Station - Just what are these numbers being broadcast?
Northern Goat-Antelope - This rare goat is proving to be popular

175750.name: The Elemental Druid (Druid Archetype)
175750.description:
From publisher blurb:

This issue introduces a new druid archetype that focuses on all things elemental. This archeteype builds upon the core abilities of the druid, allowing her to focus on one of the four elements (air, earth, fire, and water) for all aspects of her class abilities. In addition, two new spells and Elemental Infusion templates are included.

175751.name: "G" is for "Golden Age"
175751.description:
From publisher blurb:

Keem 'em Flyin', Heroes!

This entry in the Icons A to Z series looks at the Golden Age of comics, including:

World War II: On the Home Front, On the Front Lines, and Behind Enemy Lines
War Comics and the Wartime Series
Golden Age Qualities
Golden Age Devices
"Dropping in" on the Golden Age via time- or dimensional travel.

175752.name: Feats of Brutality
175752.description:
From publisher blurb:

Feats of Brutality brings you 14 mythic feats for your party powerhouse who lays about with unstoppable onslaughts that leave your enemies reeling and bloody. See feats of raw power from Cleaving Finish and Furious Focus to Impaling Critical and Raging Deathblow!

175753.name: Ten-Foot Poles
175753.description:
From publisher blurb:

Call to Arms is a book line for players and gamemasters alike. Each book focuses on a different type of item, expanding rules for those items and adding everything from new mundane and magical examples of the item to new character options related to the item. Call to Arms: Ten-Foot Poles is an April Fool’s release from the new freelancers to the Call to Arms book line. While the book started as just a silly idea, we’ve approached it the same as we would any other Call to Arms book to be sure to bring you a full range of mundane and magical poles, as well as cursed, intelligent, mythic, and even artifact poles. You can even find a few “extras” like a giant stick bug, and a new bard archetype, the “pole dancer”.

boardgamehonor: 2015 Golden Geek Best Board Game Expansion Nominee
175754.description:
Roll for the Galaxy: Ambition includes new factions, new dice, new tiles, and more for Roll for the Galaxy.

As the invention of Jumpdrive spreads through the galaxy, new factions arise. Charismatic leaders and entrepreneurs vie to complete objectives and recruit the best minds. Can you expand your faction into the most successful galactic empire?

Ambition is the first expansion to Roll for the Galaxy. It adds new factions, home worlds, and game tiles, two new dice types, and optional objectives to the base game. Newer players should play without objectives for their first few games.
175754.name: Roll for the Galaxy: Ambition
boardgamepodcastepisode: BGA Ep 85 - Best Games for Female Representation
Boardcast News 4.3.2015 | Podcast of Nonsensical Gamers
MN 0097 Expansion Round Up - Roll, Imperial Assault, Firefly
MOBG podcast 39 This is the Real Deal, Part 2 of Spiel Essen

175755.description:
Sauron threatens to push Middle-earth into eternal darkness in his desire for the One Ring. All hope lies on Frodo Baggins and his friends from the Shire. Your task: Bring the One Ring to Mordor, then destroy it in Mount Doom.

With each roll of the dice Der Herr der Ringe: Die Reise nach Mordor, players make decisions and try to move their hobbits as quickly as possible to get to Mount Doom. They're supported by Gandalf and the community, but also potentially blocked by orcs and persecuted by Ringwraiths. Players must be bold enough to choose the right dice symbols and shake off the Nazgul.
175755.name: The Lord of the Rings: Journey to Mordor
boardgamepodcastepisode: DJ91: El Señor de los Anillos: El viaje a Mordor (2015) Michael Rieneck
RJ49: Conversa de taverna... parlem de Hearthstone!

175757.name: Small Ice Cave 1
175757.description:
From publisher blurb:

Deep in the icy cavern - what dangers await your brave adventurers?

Need a quick generic map for an encounter?
A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A 20 x 20 cave map depicting an icy cave. Featuring frosty ict texures, crystals - it's the ideal location for frost trolls, yetis, and other ice encounters.

Also included is a 300dpi full size jpg, for poster printing or VTT.

175758.name: Curse of the Amber Princess
175758.description:
From publisher blurb:

Mini Quests by Survive RPG offer compelling 2-6 page adventures that are great for a one-off session, convention play or for use as a side quest to your campaign. Mini-Quests is designed for any D20 fantasy system.

In CURSE OF THE AMBER PRINCESS the travel into the Great Desert of Shifting Sands in search of the lost city of Khartopolis. What evil waits for them beneath the dunes? Will they surive?

175759.description:
At the dawn of time in an enchanted woods where no man lives there was a spring of sweet water. The animals that drank from that spring found themselves possessed of intelligence. But an evil saw this and tainted the water so that the creatures would also gain pride, greed, and form similar to man. And by so doing, soon the woods knew war.

Wood Wars 3D is a highly accessible table top strategy game for all. Developed by Joe Larson. In Wood Wars 3D, players build armies by taking race heads and putting them on class bodies to mix-and-match pawns. Then players take turns moving herds of pawns using measured distances, and attacking each other, simulating artillery attacks with marble rolls. It extends the rules of the original Wood Wars with detailed 3D printed modular minis.

Wood Wars 3D is rooted in classic strategy game and manufacture by the future with 3D printing.
175759.name: Wood Wars 3D

175760.name: Hero Detected!: Time Twist
175760.description:
This expansion not only increases the card count!
This expansion has some new gameplay mechanisms:

New skills - Construction pension

Out with the old, new capabilities sacrifice others 'Construction pension' is introduced.
This new capability is gets the player a new ability that gives him the power to recreate something of the past!

New Properties - relics

The existing four properties remains outside the new property is added.
Artifacts property cards have construction skills and pension conditions must be met when changing to a new card!
(Card-play mechanism has reference to MTG)

And ... the new cards!

New Magic! New monsters! The new facility! New resources!
And the new warriors and adventurers to threaten you, they are added to this expansion!

175761.description:
9292 is a card game for 2 to 4 players. You are are a novice cook, who finished the race that more food. Each player uses the dice and cook cards, then select the "make dishes card" to embellish one by one, alternating clockwise roll the dice.

The eyes of the dice representing the fire temperature, because each player turns plus the value rolled the dice continue, as the game progresses the fire temperature is getting higher.

Each card has its cooking dishes needed for completion [temperature] is expressed as a number, (the center of the card number), and the sum of the roll out [Fire Temperature dice, if the number of matching food card, completed its cuisine will be the.

The player rolls the dice so snugly to the number listed on the card can be obtained as a score card that dish, but if the sum of the dice eyes of fire temperatures exceeding written in cooking card, the food is discarded, and the other negative will have to take a penalty.

he game basically ends in the fifth round. Playtime is around about 30 minutes to about 20 minutes. After five rounds of fine cooking all the points in the lower-right corner of each card are counted. Charred food (upside down when imported shown) by calculating the minus 1 point per sheet of subtract points from the finished dish. The biggest sum determines the winner of the game.

175763.description:
Four powerful secret organizations are fighting for the right to rule in the old kingdom, and you can acquire safety, control, and economic dictates only through the conquest of political influence at the royal court. The more servants, nobles and dignitaries you can control, the closer you will be to the purpose. Intrigue, blackmail, or threats are suitable for all those who are struggling in the shadow of the royal throne. Power over each new aristocrat gives you a new method for influencing others. The man of absolute power behind the throne will be known soon.

Behind the Throne is quick and simple card game in which players collect sets of cards to get new special abilities. Player earn victory points for the heroes they collect, and whoever has the most victory points at the end of the game wins.
175763.name: Behind the Throne
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 81- Inis, Renegade Game Studio Contest, and Geek Out Volume 2

175764.name: A Magical Medieval Society: On the Naming of Places
175764.description:
From publisher blurb:

Bring the rich history of place names into your game! A Magical Medieval Society: On Place Names provides tips and tricks for GM interested in creating good place names for their campaign. Included is a 500+ word list providing detailed information regarding the historical naming of places in the UK. This powerful resource can be used as a guide for newly created words in a campaign language, or as a drop-and-roll resource providing limitless combinations right out of the gate.

Make the names on your maps make sense! Pick up A Magical Medieval Society: On Place Names!

175765.name: Striking Dragon
175765.description:
From publisher blurb:

This product is a little booklet of a Traveller compatible vehicle. The vehicle introduced in this installment of the series is the Striking Dragon, a heavy rocket plane

The PDF contains the background of the vehicle and statistics for its use as well as illustrations.

rpgitemversion: The Warren: un gioco di ruolo di Marshall Miller
175766.name: The Warren
rpghonor: 2015 Golden Geek Best RPG Artwork/Presentation Nominee
2015 Golden Geek RPG of the Year Nominee
175766.description:
From publisher blurb:

“In The Warren, animals are the people and humans are the apocalypse”
The Warren is a game about intelligent rabbits trying to make the best of a world filled with hazards, predators and, worst of all, other rabbits. While the rabbits in your games will solve some of their problems and discover things they never thought to try before, they are still bound by their basic physiology and nature.

The Warren is primarily a game about survival and community. There are many creatures, humans included, that are bigger, stronger, meaner, or more numerous than rabbits. The seasons and the elements do not care that rabbits are only little things. Rabbits cannot hope to meet these threats head on. Only through speed, wits, and keeping a cool head can rabbits bypass the dangers of the outside world.

This game uses a heavily-modified version of the game mechanics from Vincent Baker’s Apocalypse World. It can be played as a one-session game or a longer campaign run.

175767.name: King of Sartar (Revised and Annotated Edition)
175767.description:
From the back cover:

Listen! This is the Saga of Argrath,
Lord of the Seven Directions,
High King of the World,
who was the son of a stickpicker.

First published in 1992, King of Sartar is a remarkable work of fiction, a collection of often contradictory manuscripts from the fantasy world of Glorantha. Ancient epics, scholarly histories, kings lists, myths, fragments of stories, and other magical texts have been assembled to try to make sense of the events that ended the Third Age of Glorantha, the legendary Hero Wars. This revised edition includes a new chapter and numerous annotations that reveal secrets previously hidden from even the most die-hard fans of the setting.

175768.name: Orc
175768.description:
From publisher blurb:

Fantasy character class for use with Labyrinth Lord.

175770.name: Treasures of the Hidden Tomb
175770.description:
Welcome Archeologists! This tomb has been recently uncovered by a freak sand storm. It’s up to you and your rival archeologists to traverse the long forgotten tunnels, defeat monsters, and search for the vast treasures beyond your wildest dreams Before the tomb is once again lost to the sands of time.

On each turn, a player rolls 1d6 to determine their movement to explore the tomb. The tomb itself is broken down into 3x3 square tiles that you draw randomly and add to the map as you go. Sometimes you might find a monster Hiding in the halls. These monsters are hoarding the treasures for themselves and it's up to you to defeat them by rolling a higher dice roll than their power level. Once the monster is defeated you get the treasure for yourself. Some of this treasure may help you in your adventure, or be a curse that hinders your progression.

Be careful though. The tomb is only open for a limited time and anyone can trigger the collapse. Once the tomb collapses you have a limited amount of time to get back to the entrance. If you make it out then congratulations, count up your treasure. The archeologist with the most treasure wins! If you don't make it out, sorry about your luck. Maybe someday the tomb will be uncovered again and a future archeologist will find your corpse among a pile of valuable treasures.

175772.name: Connect Connect
175772.description:
User summary:
こねくとこねくと (Connect Connect) is a game based on the lottery mechanic called Ghost Leg ('Amidakuji' in Japan). In this game, you use strings to make connections between face-down cards, trying to reach a high score. The true paths are hidden but you get to see two cards. Can you make the right connections?

Designer's summary:
[あみだくじ]と言うくじ引きのルールを取り入れたゲームです。実際の紐を使って得点を競い合います。

175773.name: Hellweg westfalicus: Free Choice Mini-Expansion
175773.description:
Postcard mini-expansion (available for download from the designer's website in German or English)

Free Choice is a new merchandise card

The owner of the card can freely choose when stocking up or when placing a Merchandise token in a town with two trading houses one which trading house there he places a token.

But he may still place a merchandise token only in a city where he already has merchandise token(s)

175774.description:
Postcard mini-expansion (available for download from the designer's website in German or English)

Christmas Sale is a new merchandise card.

The owner can sell once in the game more than one Merchandise token in one town on the trading card.

If used carriages have to be removed don't do it before the complete sale.

A bonus for the last trading card in the game will only be counted once for that sale
175774.name: Hellweg westfalicus: Christmas Sale Mini-Expansion

175777.name: Age of Sparta
175777.description:
User Summary

Unite the powers of men and gods to protect Ancient Greece from Xerxes' invasion.

175778.description:
Playtime is over! Your parents, siblings, and neighbors have all been trying to bite you, and it's really getting in the way of your playtime. You've got a baseball and a narf gun, though, so it's go time! THEY need a time out!

Zombies!!! Jr. reimplements the Zombies!!! miniatures game with larger, thicker and fewer tiles in the playing area and artwork suitable for the entire family. Game play allows for younger kids to play while still getting the feel of the Zombies!!! game.

Game contains 15 tiles, 30 cards, 50 zombie figures, 6 player pawns, "Pow" and brain tokens and a die.

You can play against each other, with a buddy or as a group. The goal is to get to the center square of the Helipad first or with your buddy or as a group without anyone losing all of their brains!
175778.name: Zombies!!! Jr.

175779.name: Mushroom Hunters
175779.description:
You and your fellow players are mushroom hunters. You're attempting to go out onto the mushroom mountain and bring back the most mushrooms, while also selling them for the best price at market. Mushroom Hunters is played using colored meeples, curved mushroom cards, and flat price cards. Who will be the best mushroom hunter?!

Initial setup of the game requires mixing up all of the curved mushroom cards and kind of shoving them into a big pile (aka mushroom mountain). Then shuffle all of the market / price cards and deal the top five face up and place the rest in a deck face down (which I messed up for this picture, oops!). Each player gets all 5 of their specified meeple color.

On each player's turn, they can take one of the following three actions:

1) Place one of your meeples on any ONE mushroom card on mushroom mountain. The meeple must have both feet touching the card and must be STANDING in order to count. If it falls, I think you must remove it from mushroom mountain and your turn ends with no properly placed meeple mushroom hunters.

2) Return any ONE of your meeples, along with the card it is standing on, to your play area. The number of mushrooms on the card is the number that you have collected.

3) Return ALL of your meeples, along with the cards that they were standing on, to your play area. The number of mushrooms on ALL of these cards is the number that you have collected.

At any time during your turn, you can cash in any amount of mushrooms you have collected during the current or previous turns for a market / price card.

The game continues until either all of the market / sell cards have been taken by players, or all of the cards from mushroom mountain have been taken. Once the end is triggered, players count up their money and the player who has earned the most from their mushroom hunting adventure is declared the winner!

175780.name: Star Wars Galactic Adventures (Revision VIII)
175780.description:
From the website

Star Wars Galactic Adventures is a fan created role-playing game that explores the idea, "what if someone made a Star Wars role-playing game in the late 1970's or early 1980's". This 60 page rule book contains all you need to play in the Star Wars universe, while using a rule set that is familar to those who played games like classic Dungeons & Dragons.

This game provides you with 24 species, along with 9 professions, to give players diverse choices when exploring the universe. Become a group of pirates or smugglers. Take on the role of a bounty hunter. Join the republic as a pilot or be a soldier for the Sith. With the weapons and equipment, or the force powers available, you will be off into the galaxy in no time.

175783.description:
First espansion for Drizzit: the card game.
It includes:
3 new Adventure sets,
2 new Characters,
14 new Powers or Equipment cards,
10 new Adventure cards
4 Crystal cards that introduce a new rule in the game
175783.name: Drizzit: il gioco di carte – Draghi, spose e coccole estreme

175784.description:
Der Grüffelo: Das große Schattenspiel is a cooperative game for 2-4 players, ages 5 and up. The game box is turned into a small shadow theater, where silhouettes are shown in the theater before each turn. Each player is going to be the "Shadow Master", who mustn't take part in the guessing then, however. The shadows have to be discovered (colored and lovingly illustrated) as quickly as possible on the board. Who discovered the correct one of the 48 different shades scenes will be rewarded with a nut and may continue to move the team to to the next space on the forest path field. If the guess was incorrect, it costs a nut-chip and the team stone also is not being moved.

You can only win together when the team reaches the finish. In addition, the player with the most nut chips is then also the team winner. The team can just as well lose together, because we know that the Gruffalo is sometimes a pretty bad guy, which is not to be trusted so completely. Therefore, there are also shadows in the game for which there is - how mean! - no matching scene on the board. As it is, be extra careful then and be not deceived by the Gruffalo. If the Gruffalo card was four times in the game, unfortunately, the whole team has lost.
175784.name: Der Grüffelo: Das große Schattenspiel

175786.description:
Snowtide Event Cards is a mini-expansion for Oddball Aeronauts and/or for Oddball Aeronauts 2, which contains 5 cards. It was added as a funding reward to all backers of the Oddball Aeronauts 2: Double the Trouble Kickstarter campaign in 2014. The 5 cards are: Mermaids, Gift Ficklers, Icemordbergs, the Snowfather, and the Snow Maker.

From the Kickstarter page:
"Swaying and spinning their way down to this Kickstarter through the myriad flakes of snow, the Gift Ficklers have brought 5 Snowtide Event Cards (one including the Snowfather himself!)."
175786.name: Oddball Aeronauts: Snowtide Event Cards

175787.description:
Snowtide Mercenary Cards is a mini-expansion for Oddball Aeronauts and/or for Oddball Aeronauts 2, which contains 5 cards. It was a paid add-on during the Oddball Aeronauts 2: Double the Trouble Kickstarter campaign in 2014. The 5 cards are: Fir Fae, Flurriers, Snow Heralds, the Dragoneer, and the Drift Patrol.

From the Kickstarter page:
"But, not to be outdone, the Fir Fae witches have been weaving their frosty spells and have conjured from the icicles on the Snowmaker’s runners a Snowtide add-on (...) you can get your grubby paws on 5 Snowtide Mercenaries, including a new Dragoneer!."
175787.name: Oddball Aeronauts: Snowtide Mercenary Cards

175788.name: Empty Rooms and Vacant Windows
175788.description:
From publisher blurb:

The newest release for Surbrook' Stuff takes an in-depth look at haunted houses and how they can be used in your campaign. The article explores what a haunted house can be like, where it can be found, what it can contain, and why it might be haunted. More importantly, the article also notes that you can have more than just haunted houses -- towns, space ships, and even entire planets can all be haunted!

175789.name: Agaricath: Drow City
175789.description:
From publisher blurb:

A printable rpg battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl or skirmish game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset. The map is 50x50, equivalent to 25 of our standard 10x10 tiles.

Contents: An underground Drow city, deep within a cavern. Houses and shops are carved from the rock, stairs wind their way between levels and the area is lit by fungi and mysterious glows. A magic academy with lecture rooms and casting chambers sits on one side of a chasm, spanned by a pair of bridges. Sitting astride a large open area is a temple to a Spider Queen or demon, with a summoning circle and the home of a sacred spider. The Dark Elves that live in Agaricath also have an arena for combat - prisoners are held in one area before being made to fight agains terrifying creatures.

Uses: Taken prisoner by a Dark Elf, your party have become gladiators and must fight a giant centipede in the arena, infiltrate the temple of the Drow spider queen and fight the Drider that lives there, visit a Drow sorcerer at the Wizards Academy and consult them on an unholy ritual.

Download includes:

250dpi A4 pdf, with gridded map spread across 50 pages for easy printing.
250dpi A4 pdf, with gridless map spread across 50 pages for easy printing.
250dpi full jpeg versions for VTT or poster printing (gridded and gridless)




Note: Whilst the download looks large, it consists of several separate files - just download the versions you need.

A note on VTT use - we have deliberately kept the quality of the file high, and you may need to resize the jpeg for use in your VTT software. Keeping the file size and resolution high gives you the flexibility to use the map how you want - crop out a particular section or use the entire map, the choice is yours.

175790.name: Waysides: Rock Bottom
175790.description:
From publisher blurb:

So, your party walks into a tavern ...

Waysides are drop-in locales to add flavor to your town or city. Each one includes the location stats; tips on how to use it; background information on the origins and history of the place; a description with read-aloud text for the GM, and details of the rooms; the goods and services one can expect; a grided map; NPCs and their full stat blocks; and a few adventure seeds.

175791.name: Savage Worlds Creatures (Arcane)
rpgseries: Cast of Cards: On-Call RPG Characters
175791.description:
From publisher blurb:

If you play Savage Worlds, then you know their slogan: "Fast, Furious, and Fun!" And if you play any role-playing game, you know it's all to easy to get stuck generating characters, filling out record sheets and otherwise doing paperwork. Sometimes you just want to sit down and play. Sometimes you need the characters already waiting.

Sometimes you need a Cast of Cards.

Cast of Cards decks offer gamers ready-to-use Savage Worlds NPCs, monsters, and villains, complete with stats and background--you can just shuffle the deck, choose and play. Available for order on dry-erase marker-ready cards, or printable from the PDF you can download today, Cast of Cards decks save you time and effort.

Each deck offers 17 Extras (NPCs), including game stats and character backgrounds, as well as space to track Wounds in case you upgrade the Extra to a Wild Card.

About Cast of Cards: Savage Worlds Creatures (Arcane)

Drawing straight from Savage Worlds Deluxe, these seventeen magical creatures offer Savage Worlds game masters a handful of enemies or NPCs to challenge players with. From Minotaurs to Zombies - this deck will get you rolling in no time!

175792.name: Savage Worlds Creatures (Mundane)
rpgseries: Cast of Cards: On-Call RPG Characters
175792.description:
From publisher blurb:

If you play Savage Worlds, then you know their slogan: "Fast, Furious, and Fun!" And if you play any role-playing game, you know it's all to easy to get stuck generating characters, filling out record sheets and otherwise doing paperwork. Sometimes you just want to sit down and play. Sometimes you need the characters already waiting.

Sometimes you need a Cast of Cards.

Cast of Cards decks offer gamers ready-to-use Savage Worlds NPCs, monsters, and villains, complete with stats and background--you can just shuffle the deck, choose and play. Available for order on dry-erase marker-ready cards, or printable from the PDF you can download today, Cast of Cards decks save you time and effort.

Each deck offers 17 Extras (NPCs), including game stats and character backgrounds, as well as space to track Wounds in case you upgrade the Extra to a Wild Card.

About Cast of Cards: Savage Worlds Creatures (Mundane)

Drawing straight from Savage Worlds Deluxe, these seventeen non-magical creatures offer the perfect beastly adversaries, mounts or allies for your player group!

175793.name: Advanced Changelings
175793.description:
From publisher blurb:

Sisterhood of the Mismatched Eyes

With a dark heritage, changelings struggle to rise above and become a hero. These women always feel the temptation to give into their darker natures, but it is the choices they make and the relationships they choose to develop that can win the day. With these new options, you can play a changeling character, far from frail and not in need of being rescued, like never before!

Book of Heroic Races: Advanced Changelings gives you everything you need to play a changeling character. This 24-page supplement features:

Standard Racial Traits for playing a changeling, 9 alternate racial traits, and 5 new character traits to customize your character for this unique play experience
13 New Character Class Options including 6 new archetypes like the incantrix and the wayfarer, 4 new rogue talents, 2 new bloodrager bloodlines, and the cleansed sorcerer bloodline
5 New Feats expanding on your hag oriigins
6 New Changeling-Themed Spells
3 New Magic Items
3 New Deities, each with a unique perspective on family, truth and trust
Details on changeling adventurers as well as suggestions on how to incorporate this race into your world

175794.name: #Harshmode Monday (#19 - Mar 16, 2015)
175794.description:
From publisher blurb:

Every Monday the creative team from Harsh Realities will offer up small pdf documents to showcase the vast capability of the Sixcess game mechanic!

Each #Harshmode Monday will feature an NPC, Creature, Location, Adventure Seed, or any number of other interesting and useful bits for your gaming table!

175795.name: #Harshmode Monday (#20 - Mar 23, 2015)
175795.description:
From publisher blurb:

Every Monday the creative team from Harsh Realities will offer up small pdf documents to showcase the vast capability of the Sixcess game mechanic!

Each #Harshmode Monday will feature an NPC, Creature, Location, Adventure Seed, or any number of other interesting and useful bits for your gaming table!

175796.name: Kokuhaku
175796.description:
User summary:
コクハク (Kokuhaku) means 'Confession'. The players have all recently died and are taken down to Hell. Before you reach Hell, you have a chance to ascend to Heaven by confessing to your crimes and sins. Each player has seven face-down cards in front of them, each of which represents a crime or a sin they had committed during their lifetime. You must get rid of your cards before anyone else does. Only one player can take the ticket to Heaven!

Publisher's summary:
プレイヤーは全員、地獄に案内された人達・・・
天国に行ける一席を巡って生前犯した罪を「コクハク」する時間がやってきた。各プレイヤーの前に並べた7枚裏向きのカード。このカードを1番最初に無くした人の勝ち

175797.name: Bowling Cards
175797.description:
Play Bowling with Cards

There are 156 cards in the deck, consisting of:
Number cards (1 to 9)
Strike/Spare cards
Gutterball cards
Hole cards (that's an 8 )
Joker cards

There are different ways to play the game.
version 1:
Every player gets 21 cards and has to combine them as
good as possible in one serie of Bowling

version 2:
Player starts with 5 cards and then plays 1 of them and discard one card.
Before next turn player draws 2 cards and one of the cards can be the top card from discard pile,
it's not allowed to discard holecards or gutterball cards

175799.name: Artefakt (Issue 20 - 2007)
175799.description:
User summary

Issue 20 contains

scenario suggestions inspired by Gregory Peck's movie "Weites Land"
an essay by writer Ulrich Schüppler about his Goremound sourcebook
a WW II scenario for GURPS
an article on LARP
a Cthulhu scenario
an Arcane Codey scenario
a Kult scenario
a short story




as well as a few shorter contributions.

175800.description:
User summary:
Princess Escort 魔法と機械 (Princess Escort - Magic & Machine) is an expansion to Princess Escort. It adds new professions; the witch and machine soldiers. Six new cards are added to the base game, making conversation and voting more dramatic. There are also new matching tokens and a manual to explain the new powers.

To play Princess Escort - Magic & Machine, you require a copy of Princess Escort. Princess Escort - Magic & Machine cannot be played on its own.

Publisher summary:
PRINCESS ESCORTの拡張となります。新たな職業[魔法使い]と[機械兵]６種が加わり、より会話と投票が劇的になります。
175800.name: Princess Escort: Magic & Machine

175801.name: Artefakt (Issue 21 - 2008)
175801.description:
User summary

Issue #21 contains

a generic scenario idea for fantasy settings
a location for SF or steampunk settings
a campaign suggestion for Arcane Codex
an article on the early story/ roleplaying game "Cthulhus Trail" by Peter Sandullsow, dated 1969
a scenario suggestion for Kult
a short horror story
Deadlands scenario snippets (not tied to a specific edition)
a LARP convention report (conquest of Mythodea 2007)
an Arcane Codex scenario




and a few smaller contributions

175806.name: Pixie
175806.description:
From publisher blurb:

Fantasy character class for use with Labyrinth Lord.

175807.name: Sprite
175807.description:
From publisher blurb:

Fantasy character class for use with Labyrinth Lord.

175808.name: Leprechaun
175808.description:
From publisher blurb:

Fantasy character class for use with Labyrinth Lord.

175809.name: Evilution Unchained (ICONS)
175809.description:
From publisher blurb:

Evilution Unchained is a three act mystery adventure that takes the heroes throughout the city to solve a series of high profile kidnappings. Heroes will Hunt for clues on nine Fully detailed color maps to discover a horrific plot that threatens the entire campaign city.

Also, The Heroes will meet a fresh batch of full color supervillains as they try to solve the mystery of Evilution Unchained.

This adventure is Fully compatible with with ICONS Assembled Edition rulebook.

175810.name: Promethean Warriors (ICONS)
175810.description:
From publisher blurb:

As the immortal Prometheans have pulled back to their homeworld and now wage their war with the Great Dark through surgical strikes rather than mass battles, they rely on special commandos called Aliyats.

Heliox, Pallak and Phantos are three such commandos in one of the most formidable Aliyat squads.

Among their many storied adventures, they have staged raids into heart of Lost Devonia (where they famously battled with Krux Morta himself), clashed with Bloodstone Protectors on the fringes of the galaxy and stopped a Mech Centrality invasion of a civilized world by planting chrono-bombs in the invasion armada’s capital ships.

These three ICONS character are ready for use in your cosmic ICONS games immediately as heroes, allies or antagonists.

175812.name: NIP'AJIN
175812.description:
From the PDF
Ein unkompliziertes, universelles Rollenspielsystem von LUDUS LEONIS.

NIP’AJIN eignet sich für Einzelabenteuer und Kurzkampagnen, wird „nip-atschin“ ausgesprochen und ist ein Akronym für „Niemand ist perfekt, aber jeder irgendwie nützlich“. Es sorgt für verteiltes Rampenlicht, ohne die Charaktere in ein enges Regelkorsett zu zwingen.

User translation
An uncomplicated, universal roleplaying system by LUDUS LEONIS.

NIP’AJIN is suited for one-shots and short campaigns, is pronounced "nip-ut-shin" and is an acronym for „Niemand ist perfekt, aber jeder irgendwie nützlich“ (Nobody is perfect, but everybody is useful somehow). It takes care of distributing the spotlight without forcing the characters into a tight corsett of rules.

175818.name: Salvage Crew
boardgameimplementation: Star Mogul: Ruins of an Empire
175818.description:
From the rulebook:

You are a Star Mogul and the owner of a newly formed Salvage Crew. The outer rim is a treasure trove of lost
or abandoned property. Your mission is to stake your claim by force if necessary to these forgotten riches.

Salvage Crew: Star Mogul is a set of rules for use with the 25mm and 15mm scale, table-top sci-fi war games miniatures manufactured by Mega Miniatures.

175819.description:
Battle Merchants: New Kingdoms, an expansion for Battle Merchants, features an alternative Kingdom Card deck that replaces the game's existing Kingdom Cards. A few cards remain the same as originally published, but the deck includes many new cards and a few updates to existing cards.

This expansion also features a couple of new rules and Craft Tracker cards that allow all players to easily show the Craft levels of all of their weapons.
175819.name: Battle Merchants: New Kingdoms
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 4: The Battle Merchants of Bad Medicine

175820.name: BiT Evolution
175820.description:
User Summary

This SNES-inspired platformer is remiscient of Super Mario with both the colours and enemies of that world.

175821.name: Hideous Creatures: Tcho-Tcho
175821.description:
[publisher blurb]

"The nastiest people who ever lived … and whatever it is they were doing, they weren’t going to let a stranger in on it." Do you really want to know what the Tcho-Tcho know? Too late.

175822.name: Castlevania: Nocturne of the Tabletop
175822.description:
Unofficial fan-made board game based on the Castlevania series, available free for print & play only.

The game is mostly co-op, and loosely based on Castlevania 2: Simon's Quest. 2-6 players work together to fight their way through the castle while a curse is slowly killing all of them. The goal is to move through the castle, fighting monsters and overcoming various traps and other events, to gather 5 parts of Dracula's body. Bring them to the tower to resurrect Dracula and break the curse before time runs out, and then, hopefully, kill him again to win the game.

13 playable characters to choose from, each with their own deck of unique weapons and skills which are gradually unlocked throughout the game, and plenty of monsters, events, and items, so that no two games are exactly the same.

175823.name: Pixel Tactics: Game Instructor / Rodney Smith
175823.description:
Pixel Tactics promo card from Watch It Played! Season 4 Indiegogo campaign

Card text: You can choose to take up to 2 extra actions each turn. Each time you take an extra action, your opponent takes an extra action o their next turn as well.

175824.description:
In Labyrinx, players control characters with unique habilities who are exploring a dungeon. The characters’ goal is to be the first to collect five treasures. To do that they will have to slay monsters, avoid traps and open treasure chests. But beware! The tyrant who made this place to hide his treasures didn’t spare efforts, making it a labyrinth imbued with magic where the paths are in constant mutation.

The mystic energies in Labyrinx expand it in response to each exploration attempt by the players and, after a few movements, a fog will cover the paths just visited leaving behind only the memories and senses of those paying attention.

Each year, a tourney in the kingdom will hail its victor as a hero, but to the loosers there aren’t even garanties that they will be remembered…only thoese with a sharp mind, determination and some strategy will prevail in the end.

Challenge Labyrinx with you have the courage!
175824.name: Labyrinx

175825.name: Casus Belli (Issue 45 - Jun 1988)
rpgissuearticle: ...mais il restait d'autres mystères à découvrir...
Bâtisses et Artifices: Dans le silence des nécropoles
Blanche est la route du port
Celui Qui Désintégrait Dans Les Ténèbres
Combat naval moderne et jeux de simulation
Devine Qui Vient Diner Ce Soir...
Le chant de la baleine morte
Sixth, Second et Seventh Fleet, les trois frères
Sur un plateau: The Fury of Dracula
175825.description:
From the cover


Blue like hell: necropolis and scenarios to scare you
Blue like the Nile: leave for the Valley of the Kings
Blue like the sea: play the American Fleet

175826.name: Grim Legends 2: Song of the Dark Swan
175826.description:
Song of the Dark Swan is the second chapter in the Grim Legends series, immersing players in a colorful, alluring world of dangerous, secrets, dark magic, and palace intrigues. It is based on the classic tale, “The Six Swans”.

A mysterious illness has befallen the young queen of the Eagle Kingdom. A famous healer is summoned to Eagle Castle to examine her.

The protagonist is drawn into a conspiracy involving dark magic, high court intrigue, and a royal kidnapping. The healer travels to the ruined nearby Swan Kingdom to find the missing prince, and unravel the secret behind the curse.

Source: The Publisher Website.

175827.name: Retribution (Collector's Edition)
175827.description:
From the publisher's website:

In the frozen depths of winter, murderous winds mercilessly batter the crumbling Priory of Cymer. Within, trapped by their duty and the heaped snowdrifts that render travel near impossible, the few remaining faithful huddle together and tend the sacred places of their forbears. With the weather worsening, nerves fray and tempers snap as the wind howls its mournful dirge for the forgotten dead of a fallen time. But the worst is yet to come. One of those trapped within holds a murderous grudge that only blood can expunge and as the storm reaches its savage height terrible revenge is wrought amid the frigid halls and faded glories of a bygone age.

This expanded, reorganised edition of Retribution features new art and new text.

175828.name: Pinball FX 2 - The Walking Dead Table
175828.description:
Based on Telltale Games’ award-winning series, The Walking Dead Pinball is coming to a platform near you! Featuring voice work from the cast of the original game, you’ll relive key moments and make choices throughout each of Season One’s five episodes.

With recognizable locations from Clementine’s treehouse and Everett’s pharmacy in Macon down to the walker-infested streets of Savannah, players will find a breathtaking retelling of Season One that keeps the peril and drama of Lee and Clementine’s story intact.

Source: The Developer Website.

175829.name: Eccentric Exhibits
175829.description:
Eccentric Exhibits is a 2-player, 20-card trick-taking game. In this game, players are rival museum curators trying to arrange the most prestigious exhibitions of bizarre and unusual artifacts - unicorn hooves, kraken tentacles, books of pure evil, and alien skulls, to name a few.

Over four rounds, two players will play a series of tricks, trying to win artifacts for their museums and score prestige. The twist is that the highest scoring cards are not always the cards most likely to win a trick. So huge bonus points are available if you can deduce what cards your opponent is able to play and which tricks they are able to win.

With only 20 cards to keep track of, skills in deduction and risk management are paramount. Eccentric Exhibits is a tense, high-skill game for two players.

175830.description: A sandy game for 2 to 4 players aged 4 years and up. Children love sand and enjoy playing with it. They fill their sand moulds and build the loveliest sand figures. So, why wait ages for the next holiday or moan about the rain? After all, there's this super sand game for at home! In Pass auf, kleine Krabbe you have to fill the sand moulds with sand and cleverly place the sand figures onto the game board. However, you have to think carefully about where you build: because the waves wash everything away that is too close to the water! The game ends as soon as all spaces have been covered by sand figures or waves. Now you have to count up, who has the most sand figures on the game board. The player with the most is the winner.
175830.name: Pass auf, kleine Krabbe

175831.name: Buongiorno, Signorina
175831.description:
Buongiorno, Signorina is an Italian style reaction game for 2 to 6 players aged 8 years and up. Shuffle the cards and deal them face down to each player, so that each player has approximately the same number of cards. Don’t look at your cards, but place them face down in a deck in front of you. Then you continue in a clockwise direction. When it’s your turn, draw the top card from your deck. Reveal it by turning it away from you, so that you are not the first one to see it. That way, no one can accuse you of cheating! Place it in the middle of the table. Then each take it in turns to place your card on top of the card previously laid. Continue doing this until a card demands an action. Tip: the faster you turn over your cards, one after the other, the more fun it becomes.

Which cards demand which actions?

Pasta:
As long as pasta appears, nothing happens. The sort makes no difference whatsoever. The neighbour on your left plays the next card.

Re: As soon as one of the four Kings turns up, salute him very quickly. Move your flat hand to your forehead and touch it with your fingertips. It makes no difference whether you use your right or left hand.

Signorina:
As soon as one of the four Ladies appears, quickly call out “Buongiorno, Signorina” (pronounced Buonchorno Sinnjorina).

Mandriano:
As soon as one of the four Cowherds appears, quickly blow a kiss. To do this, simulate a kiss on your fingertips and symbolically blow it away.

Cavallo:
As soon as one of the four Horses turns up, like lightning, bang your flat hand down on the card(s) in the middle of the table.

This is how the game ends:
The game ends as soon as one of you has no more cards left. Have you laid your last card in the middle of the table? Then you’ve almost won. But Attenzione: if instead of showing pasta, it demands an action, then you must carry this out quickly and correctly. Therefore, make an effort so that you don’t have to take all the cards from the middle of the table. Did everything go well? Complimenti – you have won!

175832.name: Aptitudes
175832.description:
From publisher blurb:

When players level their characters, they make decisions regarding the new feats and skills they will select. These are conscious choices made by the players, usually to enhance their characters. Even unoptimal choices in a feat or skill are the players’ choice. Some players even select to advance in a different class. Often, the reasons behind these choices are hand waved as happening behind the scenes during the downtime between adventuring—the rogue somehow gains a level of wizard while the fighter learns the discipline to be a monk. It is easy to explain that the players were practicing all this time, and it gives players choices in making their characters. Aptitudes, on the other hand, are the GM’s decision to create and give out based on what players do in game.

175833.name: Core Prestige Class Simple Templates
175833.description:
From publisher blurb:

Have you ever wanted to make a bugbear that can fire magical arrows at your players, but didn’t have the time to build an NPC from the ground up? Have you ever needed a kobold assassin in a pinch? Then this book is for you!

Included are simple class templates for each of the prestige classes found in the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Core Rulebook. These templates almost exclusively use content only from the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Core Rulebook, but where abilities or feats from another book are required, those abilities have been reprinted here for your convenience.

175834.name: Serpents Below: A Lost Age Adventure
175834.description:
From publisher blurb:

Missing workers! Snake pits of prognostication! Snake people! What is the Goddess up to this time?

As our heroes travel near the small village of Fenmont on the edge of the fens, a panicked woman runs past them, wild-eyed, soaked, and covered in mud. Where has she come from? And what does her arrival portend? Will the heroes dive in and try to help? If they do, what surprises are in store?

Serpents Below is a short adventure for use with Swords & Wizardry White Box and other old-school fantasy role-playing games. Designed for 3-6 player characters of 3rd to 4th level, this module provides material for a session of adventure and includes one new monstrous race - the Cecrops!

This is a follow-up adventure to The Snake's Heart and explores a bit more of the world of the Lost Age.

175835.name: The Oni
175835.description:
From publisher blurb:

Once your kind were feared. Limitless in strength, stamina, and shape, you walked the land terrorizing, deceiving and devouring mortals on a whim.

Then they learned how to forge weapons of steel. Learned how to weave magic. Other gods saw fit to intercede on their behalf.

Some of you retreated from the mortal realm, preying upon those foolish enough to leave their walled cities, or occasionally using your powers to intrude, inciting fear and sating your bloodlust.

Others brazenly carved out their own domains, eager for any who would dare to challenge their reign.
A relative few, out of necessity, practicality, or perhaps even genuine benevolence became protectors of mortals.

What were you before? What are you now? What will you become?

The oni is not only tough as nails, but can change its shape and turn invisible. As you level up you can choose whether to become tougher, stronger, improve your existing abilities, or learn other tricks like possessing others, devouring souls, smashing your way through anyone or thing that stands before you, and more.

This product contains three files. The first is a letter-sized, two-page character sheet that features a revamped layout. The second is a digest-sized book that contains:

The oni, with 20 advanced moves.
Thematic weapons and armor.
New dungeon gear, like healing saki.
Three magic items.
A closer look at some of the moves, as well as ways to tweak the core oni.
A variant of one of the core moves (in case you prefer roll-and-hold moves).
Five extra moves that just didn't make the cut.

175836.description: Bibelbingo & Bibelmemory has two games in the box. Bibelbingo is a variation of bingo, but with bible characters, where every player gets one of the 25 bingo cards. Every card having 16 characters from the bible on them. One person draws one of the 36 characters that are in the game, explain who that is, and then all players puts a marker on that character if they have in on their own bingo card. The goal is to get a line of markers on the card. The second game in the box, is memory (Concentration), with a bible theme.
175836.name: Bibelbingo & Bibelmemory

175837.name: In the Company of Gelatinous Cubes
175837.description:
From publisher blurb:

You know you want to play an OOZE!

Glop!

Come slime someone.

Just when you thought that unsightly pasta stains had no champion, and you were comfortable in a world where mayonnaise didn't fight back, comes a Paragon Racial Class for your PC made entirely of the stuff that bursts out of mashed caterpillars. These are the rock stars of downtrodden gravy stains and greasy splotches everywhere; Become a large, intelligent cube of glop that can chase foes down and digest them before they've accepted they are being beaten up by an overachieving dessert.

Fully Compatible with the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game, from the same folks who let you play Giants, Dragons and Iron Titans, we bring you the product you never wanted. In the Company of Gelatinous Cubes!

Our April Fool's product for 2015!

175838.name: Slaughter
175838.description:
From publisher blurb:

SLAUGHTER!

Once a promising athlete with a bright future, a horrible accident caused by a fan brought him near death. But what came back wasn't the athlete, but rather the casual killer called Slaughter! Hired for his skill and powers, he's ready to take care of your campaign city's "hero problem".

175840.name: The Borderland
175840.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Borderland is the unofficial name given to a region of space in Trojan Reach sector. It is also – not coincidentally – the name of a subsector in that area. The two overlap, though the term ‘Borderland’ is sometimes used in a wider context to refer to the general area surrounding the subsector of that name.

The Borderland is a region of great strategic significance lying between the border of the Third Imperium in Tobia subsector and the territory of the Aslan Hierate in Tlaiowaha subsector. One cluster of seven star systems (the Voidsedge Cluster) lies entirely within the Borderland subsector, whilst another (the Wildeman Cluster) of eight worlds lies on the border of the Borderland and Tobia subsectors. These two clusters of worlds make up the region normally referred to as the Borderland, whatever the star charts may say about which subsector they are in.

The Borderland is a buffer zone between the Imperium and the Aslan Hierate, with its own small local powers caught between the two big players. It is a region of rather vigorous local politics, in which a handful of relatively small starships can tip the balance of power. The sort of place where the crew of a beat-up old Free Trader can make a real difference… or meet an untimely end without anyone knowing what happened to them.

This book is an overview of the Borderland; its powers and polities, their agendas and their rivalries. Further supplements will detail the Wildeman and Voidsedge clusters and the surrounding systems, presenting a wealth of adventure opportunities in a ‘small ship universe’ where a group of Travellers can rise to fame and fortune with a few good decisions, and lose it all just as quickly.

175841.name: Hangar Control
175841.description:
From publisher blurb:

This Product is a full-color, 16 x 10 inch map of a Hangar Control Room, and includes the VTT (Virtual Table top) files.

“Do you want me to alert hangar control to pull in the derelict ship with the tractor beam sir?”—Bridge Comm Officer

Hangar Control is a small two page map of a small science fiction hangar and corresponding control panel.

Hangar Control is intended for use in far-future science fiction. It could also be useful in a SciFi horror capacity.

Adventure hook for use with this map:

Last Transmission: The last transmission of a small alien craft was a broadband distress signal. The group is in control of the nearest space ship in the sector. They could go to help the aliens or to salvage their vulnerable ship depending on their heroic or villainous leanings.

When they arrive on the scene, they find a derelict ship. Sensors indicate no life signs on the ship and complete life support failure. The group is too late. The group may wish to take the ship to give the aliens a proper burial or to take the ship for scrap and look for alien artifacts on board.

If the group decides to take the small derelict ship aboard, they head to the hangar control room to inspect the ship. As they inspect the ship, some of their crew is attacked by objects on the ship which seem to be animated and moving of their own accord. Is it a ghost ship? Or is there some sort of previously unknown alien life infecting the ship such as a small silicon-based life form bonding with the objects and willing them to move? And worse will these creatures move into the group’s ship and start infecting its systems?

175842.name: One Shot Away: Operation Lam Son 719
175842.description:
Operation Lam Son 719 was the first major offensive waged by the Army of the Republic of South Vietnam (ARVN) outside of its borders. Supported by US airpower, the offensive sought to destroy the Communist supply dumps along the Ho Chi Minh trail in Cambodia and Laos, as well as disrupt any offensive by the forces of the North Vietnamese Army (NVA) and its People’s Army of Vietnam (PAVN), better known in the USA as the Vietcong. The offensive was also the first large scale test of President Nixon’s policy of “Vietnamization” in which the bulk of the war effort was to be borne by the ARVN as the US forces were withdrawn home.

The Communist high command was well aware an offensive was in the works, and planned a counter-offensive. What ensued was one of the largest battles of the war that resulted in a very costly and controversial outcome. Both sides claimed victory but in the end the overall course of the war was little changed and America’s resolve to exit the conflict only deepened.

Operation Lam Son is published by High Flying Dice Games. It is designed by Paul Rohrbaugh, with graphics by Bruce Yearian. Players use a standard deck of playing cards to activate units and resolve most combats.

175843.name: Pound Puppies Runaway-Roundup Game
175843.description:
From the box:
"The Pound Puppies are on the loose trying to avoid the dogcatcher and a stretch in the city pound. As Pound Puppies are collected the cards are inserted into holders which are specially designed for small hands to grasp. The player who is the first to collect all the puppies pictured on his/her card holder will be a doggone hero and winner of the game."

Players start with 4 dog cards in their holder. The remaining cards are shuffled and placed in the center of the table. One card is flipped over next to the deck to start the discard pile. Players can choose a card from the discard pile or the deck to add to their holder. They must exchange this new card with one in their holder. If the dogcatcher card is drawn the player must discard all of their cards and draw new ones. The first player to match all the dogs on their holder with drawn cards wins.

175844.description:
Promo item from FairPlay No. 111:
Whenever you build a trading station in a town situated on a river, you may buy 1 wine for 1 coin.
175844.name: Orléans: Weinberge

175845.description:
A skirmish game for 2 players by Néstor Romeral Andrés.

Player, welcome to the Arcade.

Your orders: Command your tank squadron and destroy the enemy. Navigate the labyrinthine arena, and blast the hostile tanks while protecting your own. This is a tactical test of skill. Lose all three tanks, and it's GAME OVER; but if you win, you might just see your initials in the high score list.
175845.name: Arcade
boardgameaccessory: Arcade: Reinforcements – Acrylic Tiles: Destroyed Floor Tokens
Arcade: Reinforcements – Acrylic Tiles: Dicecompass
Arcade: Reinforcements – Acrylic Tiles: Energy Pool Tile
boardgamepodcastepisode: BGA Ep 73 - If You Like Pandemic, Try...
MOBG podcast 39 This is the Real Deal, Part 2 of Spiel Essen

boardgamepublisher: Greater Than Games (Dice Hate Me Games)
175846.description: Deck Building: The Deck Building Game combines the thrill of building your deck with the excitement of building your deck!
175846.name: Deck Building: The Deck Building Game
boardgameexpansion: Deck Building: The Deck Building Game – The Barbecue Grill Promo
boardgameaccessory: Deck Building: The Deck Building Game – Score Pad
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 35 - Interview with Greater Than Games Christopher Badell
The Good, The Board and the Still Fighting About Agricola: Episode 37 “Theme in Euros”
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 62!!!

175847.name: Der Singende Tod
175847.description:
Publisher blurb (from their website)
AB 1
Midgard-DDD-Abenteuerband:
DER SINGENDE TOD
50 Seiten
von Rico Nielin

Die Albischen Nordmarken - Heimat des alten Clanadels der MacRathgars, raue aber zugleich auch faszinierende Hügellandschaft. Von der mächtigen Grenzstadt Twineward aus sichert der allmächtige Heereswart Ian MacRathgar mit Hilfe seiner stolzen Clankrieger die Grenze zum benachbarten Clanngadarn. Aus den zahlreichen Schluchten und Tälern des mächtigen Pengannion-Gebirgszuges starten immer wieder twyneddische Stammeskrieger ihre Raubzüge in die von zahllosen Grenzstreitigkeiten umkämpften albischen Nordmarken. Und von alldem unberührt leben die Zwerge des Pengannion in ihren unterirdischen Städten und versuchen, sich aus den Streitereien der Menschen herauszuhalten.

Doch als ein dunkler Schatten auf jenes Gebiet fällt, scheint es unverzichtbar, daß die miteinander verfeindeten Parteien der Albai, Twyneddin und Zwerge gemeinsam ausziehen, um ihre Heimat gegen einen noch viel mächtigeren Feind zu beschützen - den Singenden Tod!

Begleiten Sie den Wagenzug des Händlers Robert Quirtham auf seiner gefahrvollen Queste um das Geheimnis des Singenden Todes. Erleben Sie ein Abenteuer in dem schroffen Grenzgebirge des albischen Nordens, deren Ursprünge bis hinein in die graue Vorzeit der dunathischen Ureinwohner Albas zurückreichen.

Dieses Heft enthält ein Rollenspiel-Abenteuer in dem von einer schottisch-normannischen Kultur geprägten Land Alba auf der Rollenspielwelt MIDGARD. Es ist besonders geeignet für Spielerfiguren mittleren bis höheren Grades.

Ein Fantasy-Abenteuer auf der Welt MIDGARD für 3 - 6 Spielfiguren der Grade 4 - 8
von Rico Nielin

User summary
A Midgard scenario set in the region of Alba, suited for character levels 4-8. It was the first in the series of Dausend Dode Drolle Abenteuerbände (DDD scenario volumes).

boardgamepublisher: Greater Than Games (Dice Hate Me Games)
175848.description:
Unpub: The Unpublished Card Game is inspired by the spirit of Unpub, an organization devoted to helping game designers craft their unpolished, unpublished stones into sparkling, publishable gems!

The game comes with 54 cards, each featuring a possible game theme, a core mechanism, and game components that the players will use to craft a game idea. Each round, one player acts as publisher and uses an element from one of their cards to inspire the designers to pitch a game using two of the other three elements on cards in their hand. The best game pitch gets a publishing contract!
175848.name: Unpub: The Unpublished Card Game
boardgameaccessory: Unpub: The Unpublished Card Game – Blue Noodle

175849.name: Expanded Bananas!
175849.description:
From publisher blurb:

First there was Bananas!
But now, the bananas have been expanded!
