Need more bananas? Of course you do, that was a stupid question. Well now you can expand your already life-changing Bananas! experience with the all-new Expanded Bananas!

Inside you will find:

An All-New Nanaman Racial Archetype: The Banamazon
An All-New Cleric Archetype: The Bananscendentalist!
4 New Bananic Feats!
3 New Banana-Related Spells!
2 New Banagic Items!
9 All-New Banana-Themed Monsters!




Don’t get caught unprepared for inevitable banana-related gaming emergencies!

Instead, get Expanded Bananas!

Note: While mostly stand-alone, some material in this book requires the nanaman race found in Bananas!

User note: published on April 1, 2015

175851.name: Harqinli, the Evil Clowns
175851.description:
From publisher blurb:

Magical Minutua are free mini- supplements and rules errata for Witch Girls Adventures.

Magical Minutua 1: Harqinli

Evil clowns, prank spells and magic galore can be found in this pdf dedicated to

April Fools!

175852.description: Oh Snap! is a game for three or more players in which the players have a hand of cards. The goal is to create the best insults and retorts that include the phrases on the cards in your hand. Two of these players put down the cards they want, and the rest of the players vote on which one they like the best. The first player to reach an arbitrary number of points is the winner.
175852.name: Oh Snap! A 'Blank Cards With Text On Them' Game of Insults

rpgseries: Far Away Land RPG Adventure Module
175853.name: Dastardly Dungeon of Doom
175853.description:
From publisher blurb:

Subterranean horrors wait around every corner as your party attempts to navigate and survive a dungeon crafted by a mad dwarf genius. Traps that maim, maul, and murder fill the halls and rooms of this labyrinthine lair of last breaths. Darkness. Dread. Death...

Welcome to the Dastardly Dungeon of Doom.

175854.name: Gothic Icons
175854.description:
From publisher blurb:

Inspired by the success of the Dark Eras Kickstarter, Onyx Path Publishing has decided to overhaul every classic and new World of Darkness game in their catalog to transport the entire line back to the nineteenth century, during the height of Gothic literature’s popularity, to add Historical Angst™!

To highlight the new, gothtacular path they’ll be following, the company has filed a trademark for the phrase Historical Angst™ and created Gothic Icons to help shed some insight on where the line is headed.

Gothic Icons includes six characters that represent the gothiest Gothic icons, and have been drawn from several sources found in Gothic literature.

The gothtacular characters included in Gothic Icons employ the rules update to the World of Darkness rulebook using The God-Machine Chronicle. They are presented in chronological order of their Historical Angst™ appearance in the 1800s-ish timeframe, and include:

Captain Robert Walton: Walton is a failed poet who believed his only saving grace was to launch an expedition to the North Pole that, unfortunately, ends with his boat getting stuck in the ice. From Frankenstein by Mary Shelley, Walton represents the epitome of the suffering goth.
Countess Anna Fedotovna: The Countess is not only an arrogant yet absent-minded Russian royal who boasts friends like the Comte de Saint Germaine, but is also a gamer with “the” trick to winning card hands. From The Queen of Spades by Aleksandr S. Pushkin, Fedotovna is “the” gamer goth.
Princess Hermonthis: A four-thousand year old Egyptian teenaged mummy named Princess Hermonthis is beside herself, because she lost her foot. From The Mummy’s Foot, written by Théophile Gautier, the Princess highlights the turbulent nature of the angsty goth.
The Black Cat: No collection of Gothic characters would be complete without a terrifying Gothic creature, and this poor, distraught, one-eyed, pitiful black cat represents the emo goth. From The Black Cat by Edgar Allan Poe.
Baron Vordenburg: After taking up the charge of his vampire-hunting ancestor, Baron Vordenburg arrives in the nick of time to save the day! From Carmilla by Joseph Sheridan Le Fanu, the Baron is the iconic wannabe goth, for he’s actually never hunted or encountered a vampire before.
Thomas Carnacki: Last but not least, Thomas Carnacki is a ghost finder for England’s elite. He dresses up in Victorian era clothing, pens unusual occult tomes no one else has ever heard of, and tinkers with strange objects like his electrified pentagram. From Carnacki the Ghost-Finder, the occult investigator dresses so well, he’s labeled a Victorian goth.

175855.description:
Epic Roll is a quick-playing, dice-based, fantasy board game. While portable and simple to learn, Epic Roll also provides players with numerous strategic decisions and gambles. The result is a game enjoyable for young or casual players, as well as experienced fantasy gamers.

Players each take the role of a questing hero, battling through hordes of undead and vying to be the first to defeat the fearsome Lich. Players must balance speed and caution as they combat deadly monsters, collect treasures, and race one another towards their ultimate showdown.

Epic Roll is suitable for 2-3 players, with games lasting anywhere from 15 to 20 minutes.
175855.name: Epic Roll

175856.name: Farming Simulator 15
videogamehonor: 2014 Global Game Awards Best Simulation Game of the Year Nominee
175856.description:
User Summary

Farming Simulator 15 has new graphics and physics engine, a open Nordic environment, Woodcutting economic branch, new machines and tools such as tree harvesters, chainsaws, chippers and trailers. Manage a farm with new vehicles, tend to crops, harvest, and sell your goods while carrying out missions to take your farm to the next level. Online play with friends is exclusive to the PS4 and Xbox One.

175857.name: Aliens vs. Predator: Alien Resurrection Expansion Set
175857.description:
The Resurrection has arrived.

Welcome to the Alien Resurrection, the anxiously awaited first expansion to the acclaimed Alien vs. Predator CCG. This expansion adds new excitement to the original game by introducing new play tactics, a new official scenario, and new applications for the original cards.

Available in 9-Card Booster Packs, Alien Resurrection introduces new card types such as Barriers, Battle Conditions, Attachments, and Ammo, along with the Human Rogue and Cloned Alien factions.





Card List:

175858.name: Skylanders Skystones
175858.description:
The origins of Skystones go way back to the days of the Benevolent Ancients. While experimenting with early Portal technology and magic, they discovered a form of enchanted stone that would allow anything painted on it to become real. The Ancients worried that this power might fall into the wrong hands so they turned it into a strategy game purely for fun and leisure.

Collect all 4 SKYSTONE sets. 40 cards in all!

Four different skystone packs could be found inside marked boxes of General Mills cereal during the month of March 2015, and are used to play Skystones using the game board found on the back of the box.

GAMEPLAY:

Gameplay is identical to the mini-game within the Skylanders series of video games.

The game is played on a 3x3 grid with skystone that are red on one side and blue on the other. The object is to have more of your color skystones on the grid than your opponent.

Each player starts with 5 skystone cards dealt from a shuffled deck, and players take turns placing one of their cards with their color face up into any open space on the board. When a player places their skystone next to one or more of an opponent's skystones a battle takes place. If the attacking player wins, the defending player must flip their skystone so that it now shows the attacking player's color. Play continues until all 9 spaces are filled. The player with the most skystones of their color is the victor.

175859.name: Threshold (Issue 7 - Apr 2015) Exploring Norwold
rpgissuearticle: In the name of the Dragon
The Great Land Rush of Norwold
175859.description:
[From the cover]

Issue #7, Exploring Norwold

The seventh issue of Mystara's premier magazine continues our
journey into the frozen reaches of Norwold, detailing its region from Leeha to the Skaufskogr!

175860.name: Barricado
175860.description:
Barricado is an abstract strategy game of tile placement and area control. Each turn, players get to choose between controlling the layout of the board (by placing a tile) or claiming territory (by placing lines of tokens). The player's goal is to connect dots of their own color with a line of tokens to block other players from doing the same and to end up with the most pieces on the board at the end of the game.

The layout of the board and the barricades built upon it is always different on each play-through, as each player's strategy (and the number of players) affects the others. Optional rules can adjust play time for different audiences, as well as provide for expanded strategy for advanced players.

175861.description:
You are either Meow, or Not Meow. An eloquent game of deception, fun for all!

Infiltrators are among us! Some of our friends might be...Not Meow. Find them!

The rules of Meow are simple: On your turn, draw a card into your hand and say 'Meow'. Most cards are Meow cards, but some are Not Meow cards.

Skeptical Meows at the table can accuse you of being Not Meow after you draw and meow, which means you must reveal your hand of cards.

If they're right, and you have a Not Meow card, they win. If they're wrong, they're out of the round! And if you're the last Meow standing, you win!
175861.name: Meow

175862.name: Monorail
175862.description:
A grid of tiles are placed face-down with four stations in the corners. Players in turn take a face-down tile into their hand and choose to play it or a reserve track tile face-up in the position just vacated. The tile can be rotated in any direction they choose. Each player holds a secret hand of routes from station to station. When their routes have been completed, they are the winner.

A light tile placement game for fans of Ticket to Ride and Tsuro. Simple enough for children 5 and up.

Similar in mechanics to Indigo.

175863.name: Dinner Murder Party
175863.description:
Gather some beer, snacks, and your closest friends for Dinner Murder Party, a remix on Werewolf-Mafia like party games.

You play as one of a group of celebrity Dinner Guests gathered at an old mansion located in the Hollywood Hills or as a Murderer hidden in their midst.

As a Dinner Guest, you will be tasked with the singular purpose of bringing about the end of the world through evil, Illuminati-like, sacrificial rituals. That is unless the heroes, err the Murderers, kill all the celebrities at the party. But be careful if you’re a murderer because the celebrities will be more than happy to feast on you as the main course.

This game is great for seven or more players. An odd number of players is best, although not mandatory. Use the handy table below to figure out which roles you should be using based on the number of players you are playing the game with.

175864.name: Stratego Conquest
175864.description:
Stratego Conquest is an entirely new Stratego game for two to four players. The game is played on a map of a small continent that forces players to confront each other on multiple fronts.

The object of the game is to capture your opponents' flags while protecting your own. Before the game begins, players divide up the continent and place their units on the map. During the game you can use action cards to deploy more units, spy on your opponents, and even make pinpoint strikes deep into enemy territory. Maneuver your units across the board, wage war, and be the last player with a flag to win the game.

175865.description:
All the paranoid 60s spy fun of [redacted], now in the open air, and for up to 7 players!

In [redacted]: Garden Party, the action moves outside. The added board allows for more space, enough for a 7th player to enter the embassy. The added locations also allow for even more cool actions and feints to be done, in addition to more ways to reach critical parts of the building.

The added space to maneuver, additional missions, and new ways to escape with the intel actually make the game even faster by using the expansion. For example, using the Garbage Drop allows for an agent to look at discarded items and grab the gear necessary to escape a sticky situation.
175865.name: [redacted]: Garden Party

175866.name: Super Splatters
175866.description:
Get ready for the incredibly challenging and addictive Super Splatters!

In Super Splatters you’ll be throwing a band of semi-suicidal Splatters across the stage, blowing them up in an attempt to ignite a series of explosions. But unlike other flinging games, shooting here is really just your opening move.

Perform crazy stunts, boost your speed on slides, invent your own moves, redirect your shots, or even merge several blobs together – all in an attempt to reach the most spectacular finale that will amaze your in-game fans!

With elastic suicidal blobs and extraordinary liquid physics that actually affect the way you play, Super Splatters delivers fresh gameplay, ripe with tons of tricks to explore. Play it causally or get into the combo-hungry-fast-paced-action-packed-arcade-mayhem – it’s really up to you!

Source: The Developer Website.

175867.description: [microfilms] is a microgame set in the world of [redacted]. Using only 25 cards, players try to deduce each other’s identities and objectives. [microfilms] features some of the same mechanisms as [redacted], most notably the double-blind interrogation. The first spy to collect the right item and the correct information wins.
175867.name: [microfilms]

175868.name: Metro 2033: Breakthrough
175868.description:
English description:

The year is 2033 A.D. The world is after a nuclear war. The planet surface is contaminated with radiation and almost unfit for habitation. The mutants reign supreme on it. Cities lay in ruins; small groups of survivors hide in bomb shelters. The Moscow Metro is the biggest one, the last retreat for human race after the Judgment Day.

Metro 2033: Breakthrough, based upon the cult science fiction novel Metro 2033 by Dmitry Glukhovsky, allows you to descend into the tunnels of Moscow subway as a leader of the underground post-apocalyptic group and lead it to victory!

The players complete trade and war quests, repel the mutants' attacks, trade at markets, and join the metro stations under their banners. The player whose faction gains the most influence wins!

Russian description:

2033 год. Мир после ядерной войны. Поверхность планеты заражена радиацией и почти непригодна для жизни, на ней безраздельно властвуют мутанты. Крупные города превратились в руины, а горстки выживших прячутся по бомбоубежищам, самое большое из которых — московское метро. Именно оно — последнее пристанище человечества после Судного дня.

В этой настольной игре по мотивам культового фантастического романа Дмитрия Глуховского «Метро 2033» вы сможете спуститься в туннели московского метрополитена, возглавить одну из группировок постъядерного подземелья и привести её к победе!

Участникам партии предстоит выполнять задания, отбивать атаки мутантов, торговать на рынке и объединять станции метро под своими знамёнами. Игрок, фракция которого добьётся наибольшего влияния, будет объявлен победителем!

175869.name: An Average Modern Outhouse
175869.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Thunderbox has been apart of daily lives for many years and has seen a resurgence in recent years. This structure can take many forms and can be comprised of many different building materials from brick to wood.

We hope you can find a place for this Thunderbox in your game!

What better location for a Thunderbox is there than the Old West. We hope that you will also check out our latest Kickstarter: Wild West Floorplans!

175870.name: Ultimate Three Kingdoms Guide (EGS)
175870.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Three Kingdoms period of ancient China was born from the decentralization of the Chinese government and the rise of regional warlords. With the fall of the Han Dynasty, these warlords ruled their over their provinces and battled for control of the land. After only three remained, the three kingdoms of Wei, Wu and Shu were formed, but the battles did not end. These new three kingdoms continued their quest for control of the lands until only one remained, ushering in the next dynasty.

Ultimate Three Kingdoms Guide is a detailed look at the kingdoms and warriors of the Three Kingdoms period in ancient China. This period was a chaotic time between the beginnings of the fall of the Han Dynasty to the rise of the Jin Dynasty, roughly from 184 to 280 CE, commonly known as the Three Kingdoms period. Step into the fray as the Kingdoms of Wei, Wu, and Shu vie for control of the lands.

Ultimate Three Kingdoms Guide includes:

Historical equipment utilized during the Three Kingdoms period
A look at the three kingdoms
A listing of Chinese commanders and generals
A comprehensive timeline of battles during the Three Kingdoms period
Character options for making Chinese warriors
A Three Kingdoms adventure
… and more!




Ultimate Three Kingdoms Guide is your source for building warriors like those of history, or building the foundations of a historical or alternate history game set during the Three Kingdoms period.

175871.name: Mariner Hybrid Class
175871.description:
From publisher blurb:

The mariner is a special warrior, dedicated to ridding the ocean of the sea devils that populate its darkest depths.

Herein are the secrets of this Fighter-Ranger hybrid class. Included along with this class are:

Eight New Feats tailored for characters playing in underwater campaigns.
Special Rules for tracking underwater.




And much more!

175872.description:
50 States and the District of Columbia make up our Electoral College, the goal of the game is to win states and get the most votes. Each player will be dealt a total of three candidate cards--these will include 24 of our nations most influential Presidents throughout history. From those cards you will choose one candidate and that will be yours for the remainder of the game. Not all candidates will be able to gain states as easily as others, the 'Political Cause' cards can help get a candidate Electoral Votes that they normally could not get just on merit alone.
Throughout your turns, you will gain Political Allies and use their Historical Influence to gain States (each worth different Electoral Votes) and to assist in becoming the next President. You will have to come up with the best strategy to ensure you get the most votes to beat your opponents.
175872.name: RePresidency

175873.name: The World of Avatar: The Last Airbender
175873.description:
From Introduction:

The world of Avatar: The Last Airbender takes place in a world home to humans, fantastic animals, and spirits.

Human civilization is divided into four nations: the Water Tribe, the Earth Kingdom, the Fire Nation, and the Air Nomads.
Each nation has a distinct society, wherein people known as Benders have the ability to manipulate the eponymous element of their nation using the physical motions of martial arts.

At any given time, there is only one person alive capable of 'bending' all four elements: the Avatar, the spirit of the planet in human form.

When an Avatar dies, this spirit is reincarnated into the next nation in the Avatar Cycle, in the order of the seasons, and must master each bending art in seasonal order, starting with their native element. Additionally, the Avatar possesses an ability called the Avatar State, which briefly endows it with the knowledge and abilities of all past Avatars as a self-triggering defense mechanism, which can be made subject to the will of the user by extensive trial and training.

If an Avatar is killed in the Avatar State, the reincarnation cycle is broken, and the Avatar entity will cease to exist.

Through the ages, the succeeding Avatars have served to keep the four nations in harmony, and maintain world order. The Avatar serves as the bridge between the physical world and the spirit world, allowing each to solve problems that normal benders cannot.

175874.name: Plasma Room
175874.description:
From publisher blurb:

This product is a full-color, 48 inch by 30 inch, floor plan of a Plasma Room, with Hex, Square and No overlay.

The PDF includes includes the VTT (Virtual Table Top Images for online play).

“That damn plasma battleship is laying waste to our fleet. It must be destroyed or our fleet will end up as nothing but space debris.”—Space Admiral Roarke

Plasma Room is a single interior map of a large power room that could power a space ship, space station, or large terrestrial factory.

Plasma Room is intended for use in far-future science fiction.

Adventure hook for use with this map:

Destroy the Plasma Battleship: The enemy plasma battleship is laying waste to the group’s side in a space battle. They are sent to sneak onboard and sabotage the main plasma battery that powers the battleship’s engine and devastating plasma cannons. The group has to sneak on board, get to the plasma room, sabotage the room, and escape the battleship before their explosives destroy the plasma cooling tanks. With the cooling tanks destroyed, a massive buildup of plasma energy overheats of the plasma engines and a catastrophic explosion.

175875.description:
A BOARD GAME CREATED FOR SOCCER AND GAME FANS ALIKE!

Mini Copa is a soccer board game where you can play with the athletes behaviour and skills in a realistic and simple way, Each new play benefits from your good technical eye and an athletes’ sense of opportunity.

The mechanics of the game is broad enough to represent anything that can happen in a live soccer match. Each player, in alternating rounds, can use different actions with his team in an agile manner, while deciding to focus on the technical, physical or psychological aspects of the sport. These choices allow the development of teams with very varied personalities.

The board game will begin in a more basic form, with four national teams and rules to play endlessly unique matches. But, with the help of additional goals, we can unlock and release the game’s full fledged potential by means of the campaign mode, in which the rules for managing the entire technical and administrative team, including trainings, casting athletes, managing the teams resources, fully customizable teams and even stadiums construction will be out allowing a hugely expanded strategical and tactical options in the best and definitive soccer game ever made!

NOTE: WE ARE CURRENTLY UNDER A CROWDFUNDING CAMPAIGN ON: https://www.sibite.com.br/ViewCampaign.php?cid=63

Check out the project in english and english subtitles as well! Don't forget to invest and share!
175875.name: Mini Copa

175877.name: On The Run
175877.description:
On The Run is a strategic turn-based card game about bank robberies, tampering with evidence, and backstabbing your friends.

You and your crew have robbed a bank and have split the money evenly. Unfortunately, for you and your thieving friends, you've left behind evidence at the scene of the crime.

Each player will take turns trying to remove the evidence, place additional evidence to link other players to the crime, and attempt to steal more money.

boardgamehonor: 2015 Golden Geek Most Innovative Board Game Nominee
175878.description:
In a distant future, scientists were able to build small alternate Earths. Exactly 504 such Earths have thus far been built. The scientists programmed each of these Worlds with an individual set of laws and rules which the residents strictly follow and consider most important for their lives. These may be exploration, consumption, economics, military, etc., and each is unique. You can visit all of these 504 alternate Earths to experience how the people are living, and decide which of these worlds harbors the best civilization. On which World do you want to live? Explore them all and decide!

504 is a game that creates 504 different games out of one box. The game consists of nine modules:


Module 1: Pick-Up & Deliver
Module 2: Race
Module 3: Privileges
Module 4: Military
Module 5: Exploration
Module 6: Roads
Module 7: Majorities
Module 8: Production
Module 9: Shares


In each single game, you take three different modules from the nine available and assemble them in any order you like to create a new game. (504 = 9 * 8 * 7 = the number of distinct permutations of three items from a set of nine. The order of the three game modules is significant, and modules cannot be repeated.) For example, you can play:


a racing game that expands through exploration with technology improving the racing or exploration (World "253").
an 18XX-style stock game with network building for income and production sites to provide workers for the road building (World "968").
a war game with a pick-up and deliver economy and bonus scoring from majorities ("World 417").


Each single game takes from 30 to 120 minutes to play.
boardgameaccessory: 504: Set-Up Poster
boardgamefamily: Stronghold Games: The Great Designer Series
boardgamepodcastepisode: Boardcast News 4.16.15 | Podcast of Nonsensical Gamers
Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 018 – Star Wars: Rebellion vs Star Wars: Imperial Assault
Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 019 – 10 Reasons to Buy a Game
Dukes of Dice - Ep. 60 - La Strong-ja
Ep 28 Stronghold Games Publishing With Stephen Buonocore
Episode 15: Survive: Escape from Atlantis!, Trading Places, and Cardinal Quest
Episode 19: So Many Topics, So Little Time
Episode 81 -- Eating Cake in Bellevue (Part B, the Second)
Low Player Count - Ep 16 - It's BGGcon Y'all!
MOBG podcast 39 This is the Real Deal, Part 2 of Spiel Essen
RDTN Episode 77 – Fortress Around Your Heart: A visit from the Podfather – Stephen Buonocore, Game Day with Pete and Scott
RJ47: Friday afternoon with Friedemann Friese
The Game Pit: Episode 50 - Treasure Hunt Essen 2015 Part 2
The Game Pit: Episode 71 - Spiel ‘16 Council Chamber with Stephen Buonocore
The Good The Board and the Sorry for being late: episode 13 Worker Placement
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 43!!! All By Myself

175879.description:
Ruddy Vikings is a strategic card game with a cartoon style and a Viking based theme.

How to play?
The aim of Ruddy Vikings is to destroy the cards in your opponents hand. When you lose all of your cards you lose and are out of the game.

Ruddy Vikings is super easy to pick up and play and super fun for players of any age with a difficulty curve that starts simple and increases as you learn more strategies. An average game between 2 players lasts approx 5-15 minutes with games of more players lasting longer.

Ruddy Vikings Heroic Deck

The Heroic Deck is filled with all sorts of goodness! Heroic Viking Cards have built in buffers which make them more likely to get past defences. This coupled with new defences and new buffers mean that players never have to stop having fun filled bearded gaming sessions.

Ruddy Vikings is currently live on Kickstarter https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/roundedsquarish/ruddy-v...
175879.name: Ruddy Vikings
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 16 - King of Tokyo & Scary Movies

175880.description:
In Dirty Detectives, everyone has been assigned to solve the same murder, but solving murders is hard work, so instead each detective is going to try to frame someone for murder. Each time a player touches a piece of evidence, they learn what it is, but unfortunately now that evidence points to their involvement in the crime!

The games uses 17 cards, 16 of which are laid out in a 4x4 grid with the 17th card in the active player's hand. Each card has an arrow on the back of it, and during play these arrows point at the players.

On a turn, you have the one extra card in hand and pick up any card from the board. You choose one of these cards and place it face-down in the empty space with the arrow pointing to you; to end your turn, pass the card still in hand to your left-hand opponent, who now takes their turn.

On your turn, you can also make an accusation. To do this, name a weapon and a motive, then pick up two cards pointing to the same opponent and look at them. If these cards match what you said, reveal these cards to everyone because you've just won the game; if you're wrong, however, place these cards facedown once again, but now pointing at yourself.

Each card also has a special reveal benefit. When you place a card facedown on the board pointing at yourself, normally only you know what that card is; if you reveal the card, everyone now knows what it is, but you get to do the reveal benefit on that card, e.g., looking at cards without pointing them at yourself or rotating cards to point at opponents.
175880.name: Dirty Detectives

175881.name: Treasure Map
175881.description:
Treasure Map uses 16 unique double-sided cards. One side of the cards is used to layout the island. There is treasure hidden somewhere on this island. Then players use the other side (the map-side) of the card to play one of the several different ways to play.

Game Mode: Treasure Island
One every space of the island without an icon, place a coin. The each player chooses a space with an icon and places their pawn on it.

Then players take turns playing cards, and choosing on of the available actions from the card.

Move to the icon - move your pawn to the icon on the card, if this cause your pawn to move in a straight line then pick up any coins passed along the way
Move steps - move your pawn one space for each set of footprints on the card, picking up any coins passed along the way
Pick up via strokes - for each stroke on the card, pick up one coin from an adjacent space




First one to 12 coins wins.

Game Mode: Gentlemen Pirates
Each player takes one card and looks at the icon on the map-side of the card. This is where they treasure is hidden.

Players then asking yes or no questions to try to locate each others' hidden treasure.

Example questions:
Is you treasure hidden next to a red icon?
Is your treasure hidden on the coast of the island?
Is you treasure hidden by a palm tree or a lighthouse?

Players take turns asking a question, the first one to figure out where their opponent's treasure is hidden wins!

175882.description:
Unstable Isotope is a micro party game. Each player gets a subset of the cards that represent an unstable isotope that is about to become stable by kicking something out of it.

If you are going to get ejected out of the isotope, you can save yourself by correcting finding a different subatomic particle to eject in someone else's hand.

If you get ejected, you are out until the next round.

Knocking someone out scores you subatomic particles. The first one to collect a whole set wins!
175882.name: Unstable Isotope

175884.name: Cazadores de Leyendas
175884.description:
From editor´s web:

Occult science experts , unscrupulous tomb riders and adventurers without fear of risk. Join these Hunters Legends and travel the world through nine intense adventures that form the Hitos system new campaign in which, as usual, find everything you need to enjoy them without any additional book.

De la web del editor:

Expertos en ciencias ocultas, saqueadores de tumbas sin escrúpulos, contrabandistas de lo imposible y aventureros sin temor al riesgo. Únete a estos Cazadores de Leyendas y recorre el mundo a través de nueve intensas aventuras que forman la nueva campaña del sistema Hitos en la que, como es habitual, encontrarás todo lo necesario para disfrutarlas sin necesidad de ningún otro libro adicional.

175885.name: Despertados
175885.description:
From editor´s web:

Awakened proposes an event that will "happen" to the characters and where they are not given any power of decision. Introduces the characters being convinced by an unknown person to make him a favor and waking up in a strange place the next morning, forgetting what happened. Should investigate their surroundings and find the clues to reconstruct the events of last night, it seems, those involved in a murder.

De la web del editor:

Despertados propone un suceso que les «ocurre» a los personajes y en el que no se les da ningún poder de decisión. Presenta a los personajes siendo convencidos por una persona desconocida para que le hagan un favor y despertando en un lugar extraño a la mañana siguiente, sin acordarse de lo ocurrido. Deben investigar su entorno y encontrar las pistas para recomponer los sucesos de la noche anterior que, parece, los involucran en un asesinato.

175886.name: Nights of Barrow-Wight
175886.description:
From the cover

A Miro Quest Card: Every third full moon all Dolores and windows are locked and shuttered. No ventures past their doorstep for days except to care for livestock. The residents of Wheatwind have accepted this time of fear as part of the price to pay to farm the best and most fertile soil for many miles.

175887.description: This ship is the competitive prize for Month 1 of the Star Trek: Attack Wing Organized Play tournament, the Q Continuum.
175887.name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – U.S.S. Hood Expansion Pack
boardgamefamily: Star Trek: Attack Wing Miniatures Game

175888.description: This ship is the competitive prize for Month 2 of the Star Trek: Attack Wing Organized Play tournament, the Q Continuum.
175888.name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – I.K.S. Korinar Expansion Pack
boardgamefamily: Star Trek: Attack Wing Miniatures Game

175889.description: This ship is the competitive prize for Month 3 of the Star Trek: Attack Wing Organized Play tournament, the Q Continuum.
175889.name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – I.R.W. Terix Expansion Pack
boardgamefamily: Star Trek: Attack Wing Miniatures Game

175890.name: IAMJASON
175890.description:
User Summary

A point-and-click adventure game made for the February 2015 AGS (Adventure Game Studio) community contest, IAMJASON tells the tale of Jason, who finds himself in a strange sci-fi environment, and is told by a "stranger" to "battle the corruption"

It features a distinctive visual style, in no part thanks to its ultra-low 160*90 resolution.

Being made by a single developer in a single month, IAMJASON is relatively short and takes about an hour to complete.

175893.name: Bedroom Battle
175893.description:
Bedroom Battle is a game for couples where you play against each other to win rewards in the form of sexy favors.

The concept is very simple. Each game round you use battle cards to compete for a reward card containing three different sexy challenges. The winner of the round then gets to select one of the sexy challenges for you both to act out. Once you have completed the challenge you move on to the next round and start playing for a new reward card. To make things interesting the rewards will become more and more naughty until the game ends with the final reward - which of course is the naughtiest of them all.

175894.name: Postapocalyptica
175894.description:
From editor´s web:

Postapocalyptica: Last Waiting is an adventure game for Hitos system, set in a devastated future. The protagonists are young members of the Last community who are forced to leave the inhospitable outside world in a race against time to save their loved ones. When everything goes against you, they will have no choice but to grow up.

De la web del editor:

Postapocalyptica: Última espera es una aventura para el sistema de juego Hitos ambientada en un futuro devastado. Los protagonistas son jóvenes miembros de la comunidad de Última que se ven obligados a salir al inhóspito mundo exterior en una carrera contrarreloj para salvar a sus seres queridos. Cuando el todo se pone en su contra, no les quedará otro remedio que madurar a pasos agigantados.

175895.name: El Judio Errante
175895.description:
From editor´s web:

The Wandering Jew is set in the present and the flavor pulp adventure stories of the campaign. Designed for Hitos system, in this book you will find everything you need to play fast-paced action story and travels around the Old Continent.

De la web del editor:

El Judío Errante es una campaña ambientada en la actualidad y con todo el sabor pulp de las historias de aventuras. Diseñada para el sistema Hitos, en este libro encontrarás todo lo que necesitas para jugar esta historia de acción trepidante y viajes por todo el Viejo Continente.

175896.description:
The Evasive Maneuver Action Template is a participation prize given to players who participated in Month 1, "Encounter at Farpoint," of the Star Trek: Attack Wing Storyline Organized Play Event, Q Continuum. It is considered a Resource, and costs 5 Squadron Points.

Each round, one of your ships may use the Evasive Action Maneuver instead of a normal maneuver by selecting a red or come about maneuver on its dial. You perform the maneuver using the special template.
175896.name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Evasive Action Resource
boardgamefamily: Star Trek: Attack Wing Miniatures Game

175897.name: Plata de Ley
175897.description:
From editor´s web:

Sterling Silver is a story set in the Wild West of the late nineteenth century, around 1890. It is designed for play only with this book campaign. It is divided into seven parts that are played in succession. In each of these characters go one step further in his attempt to become rich and get rid of the forces of law to pursue.

De la web del editor:

Plata de Ley es una campaña ambientada en el Salvaje Oeste de finales del siglo XIX, alrededor del año 1890. Está diseñada para jugarse solamente con este libro. Se divide en siete partes que se juegan de forma sucesiva. En cada una de ellas los personajes avanzan un paso más en su intento de hacerse ricos y de librarse de las fuerzas de la ley que los persiguen.

175898.description: Damage Control Teams are a participation prize given to players who participated in Month 2, "Deja Q," of the Star Trek: Attack Wing Storyline Organized Play Event, Q Continuum. It is considered a Resource.
175898.name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Damage Control Teams Resource
boardgamefamily: Star Trek: Attack Wing Miniatures Game

175899.description:
Ready Room Cards are a participation prize given to players who participated in Month 3, "All Good Things," of the Star Trek: Attack Wing Storyline Organized Play Event, Q Continuum. It is considered a Resource and costs 5 squadron points.

When using the resource, you begin the game with 4 Mission Tokens on your Ready Room Card.

Once per round, one of your ships may spend 1 of these Mission Tokens (i.e. remove it from the game) to achieve the following effects:

1) During the Activation Phase, when you reveal your maneuver, before you move, you may add up to +2 to your speed.

2) At the start of the Combat Phase, increase your Captain Skill Number by +2 until the End Phase.

3) At any time you may replace 1 [EVADE], [SCAN], or [BATTLE STATIONS] Token that is beside your ship with 1 [EVADE], [SCAN], or [BATTLE STATIONS] Token.

OR

4) Prevent your Captain from being disabled or discarded by an enemy ship's Captain or Upgrade Card.

A player cannot use these abilities for a ship that has no Captain Card or whose Captain Card is disabled.
175899.name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Ready Room Resource
boardgamefamily: Star Trek: Attack Wing Miniatures Game

175901.name: Law & Destiny: A Guide to Arbiters and Seers
175901.description:
From the back cover:

Neither the word of law nor the fabric of destiny can be ignored!

In the chaos that has gripped the Known Lands since the Darkfall brought ruin, there are but a handful of those who stand against the madness and ensure that order reigns. The arbiters, scions of justice and law, stand ready to defend those who cannot defend themselves. The seers, once a powerful order but virtually eradicated on the eve of the Darkfall, seek only to find the truth of what has happened and, in doing so, bring hope back to the world. Neither task will be simple, but these are not ordinary men and women… these are heroes.

Law & Destiny is the third in a series of sourcebooks that more closely examines the base classes of the Thunderscape: the World of Aden campaign setting! In this installment, you will not only find extensive mechanical support for the Arbiter and Seer classes, but a wealth of new options that any class can make use of, including archetypes, spells, feats, equipment, and more!

175902.name: From Varese to Tre Ponti
175902.description:
From Varese to Tre Ponti is an expansion to San Fermo with two more battles of the same 1859 Garibaldi campaign in the Italian Second Independence War. It contains two battles, each with their own small map, rules to play the three events as a campaign, and just a few information counters usable for both games. With a VP-based bidding, players can change almost all of the battle conditions, making each game different from the ones before.

A curiosity: The counter sheet includes several nice and colorful counters for a future game (by the same team) dedicated to WW2 tactical combat.

175903.name: The Long Con
175903.description:
From the publisher:

Sidney Pryce wants the protagonists’ help to set up a Big Store, to sucker a rich American into thinking he’s buying into a Burnt Auction. The rewards, Pryce promises, are incalculable; but soon after Pryce enlists their help, strange bird-creatures haunt the protagonists. How, they wonder, does Japanese folklore figure into it?

A London-based Trail of Cthulhu scenario by Adam Gauntlett.

Limited to 50 signed and numbered copies (Author's signature on included bookplate.)
44 pages.
Cover art by Chris ("H.P. Podcraft") Lackey.
Spiral bound A4 landscape format, 170 gsm paper stock.
Separate handouts including colour period maps.
Bears the "Seal of Yog-Sothoth".

175904.description: A special promotional card that lets you face off against a level 6 version of the Dark Titan Agranok when using The Dark Titan expansion. This version of Agranok has a 50% chance to make you banish a card, and a 50% chance to move two additional spaces.
175904.name: Castle Panic: The Dark Titan – Level 6 Agranok Promo

175905.name: Caravel At Sea
175905.description:
From publisher blurb:

This full color battlemap is the 246th of a series featuring various terrains. This installment of the battlemap series features the deck of a caravel navigating the fog obscured, treacherous rocky shallows.

The map is 28 x 30 squares in size, with each 1 inch square scaled to represent 5 feet. It is provided in 12 segments, which need to be assembled, in a single PDF using the letter format.

The product has been updated to include a large gridless JPG image of the map, intended for use with VTT software. It is 4032x4320 pixels in size at 144dpi.

175906.name: Lord of Gloomthrone
175906.description:
From publisher blurb:

For a level 12 party!

Agents of the Underdark are attempting to complete a dark ritual in the icy depths of Gloomthrone Citadel, a ritual that would surely spell disaster for the kingdom if completed!

Led by the priestess of Lolth, Z'ress Baenre, a coterie of drow have overtaken the abandoned tower and fortified it with their minions. It's a race against time for the PCs to make their way through Gloomthrone's defenses, and put an end to Z'ress and the foul magic she is using.

175907.name: Insidious Experiments
175907.description:
From publisher blurb:

For a level 4 party!

Haedirn Lastlight is a respected elven wizard and sage. After the death of his lover Lyonthel, the elf has been overcome with grief and has locked himself away in his study- a small manor on the cliffs of Wailing Crag. Haedirn has not been seen for over a year now, and those that knew him are beginning to worry.

Worse still, a band of ogres has been terrorizing the nearby town, slaughtering the town folk and haughtily boasting the elf wizard is dead. The PCs must put a stop to the ogres' attacks, make way to Wailing Crag to root out the rest of their gang, and lay Haedirn Lastlight's tortured remains to rest.

175908.name: Bandit's Nest
175908.description:
From publisher blurb:

For a level 1 party!

A flock of kenku bandit's have discovered the ruined remains of a temple site, and have used it as their hideout while they raid unsuspecting travelers on nearby roads. It's up to the PCs to clear their nest, recover stolen goods, and rescue their hostages. Will the players be bested by these dirty birds? Or will they have the bandits eating crow?

175909.name: The Power of Rock and Roll
175909.description:
From publisher blurb:

Take a rock and roll adventure into space with this great super hero adventure for Heroes Wear Masks.

This adventure for use with the Heroes Wear Masks RPG system comes with everything you need to run the adventure as well as figure flats of all the characters you will encounter in the game.

175910.name: Infinite Threats 01
175910.description:
From publisher blurb:

Need a few alien scum to kill off in your Infinite Futures Games? Are your players bored with blasting droids and robots? Well Avalon has just the thing, new threats to encounter. Each threat is a fully detailed foe, usable in any game you want or as part of the Fringe setting.

Explore the danger of space with new Threat expansion, so keep your eye out for new releases and expansion for the Infinite Futures system.

Inside you will find fully detailed stats and information on…

The Cyber Assassins
The alien Cymarks and their powerful psychic threats
The horror of the Hive Drone Warrior
The warlike Tealniks
The Zone Trooper, a chemically enhanced warrior
And the Too-Nia Caste Warrior

175911.name: Princes of the Plains: Halfling Archetypes
175911.description:
From publisher blurb:

Score One For the Little Guy!

Down to earth in more ways than one, halflings are a practical and quiet sort of folk, who still sometimes possess a strong mischievous streak. Though they’re known best for their small stature, their bravery and courage in the face of adversity is the subject of many a legend, as is their incredible luck.

Of course, when you choose to make your player character an halfling, all that you really care about is the +2 bonus to your Dexterity and Constitution scores (and who needs Strength, anyway?), so why bother playing a halfling barbarian or fighter? Even if a +2 bonus doesn’t really make that much of a difference, it just feels so wrong to knowingly combine a race and class that don’t go well together, and, as a result, many players never bother to consider it.

This book aims to give players who want the fact that their character is a halfling to matter more a way to make that happen, while also providing support for halfling characters of a variety of classes that don’t typically make much mechanical sense for halflings. Included are the halfling berserker, a barbarian archetype that allows halflings to wield weapons of incredible size, and move with great speed, the halfling knee cracker, a brawler archetype that centers on focusing a lot of damage in a small package (and of course shattering kneecaps), the halfling beastrider, a cavalier archetype for halflings that form an especially close bond with their mounts, the halfling hamstringer, a fighter archetype for halflings who focus on getting so close that their opponents can’t hit them, the halfling spelldart, a magus archetype that focuses on imbuing darts and sling bullets with magical power, and the halfling wanderer, a ranger archetype for well-traveled halflings.

175912.name: Outlaws of the Burning Plains (3rd Edition)
175912.description:
From publisher blurb:

Deadly Outlaws roam the Burning Plains. Some are vile and evil, others are simply desperate. The ruthless Alexander Justice, folk heroes the Jackson Brothers, the brutal Ezekiel Trapper, the deceptive Bonnie Carpenter, and the horrific Justin Spade. These outlaws might make deadly enemies to any group of players, or become strange allies to those willing to ride beyond law and order.

boardgamehonor: 2015 Golden Geek Best Strategy Board Game Nominee
2015 Golden Geek Board Game of the Year Nominee
2015 Golden Geek Most Innovative Board Game Nominee
2016 International Gamers Award - General Strategy: Multi-player Nominee
175914.description:
"Lemonade? They want lemonade? What is the world coming to? I want commercials for burgers on all channels, every 15 minutes. We are the Home of the Original Burger, not a hippie health haven. And place a billboard next to that new house on the corner. I want them craving beer every second they sit in their posh new garden." The new management trainee trembles in front of the CEO and tries to politely point out that... "How do you mean, we don't have enough staff? The HR director reports to you. Hire more people! Train them! But whatever you do, don't pay them any real wages. I did not go into business to become poor. And fire that discount manager, she is only costing me money. From now on, we'll sell gourmet burgers. Same crap, double the price. Get my marketing director in here!"

Food Chain Magnate is a heavy strategy game about building a fast food chain. The focus is on building your company using a card-driven (human) resource management system. Players compete on a variable city map through purchasing, marketing and sales, and on a job market for key staff members. The game can be played by 2-5 serious gamers in 2-4 hours.
175914.name: Food Chain Magnate
boardgameaccessory: Food Chain Magnate: Improved Rules and Aids
Food Chain Magnate: Milestone Boards & Card Accordion
boardgamepodcastepisode: Broken Meeple Reviews - #8 - Food Chain Magnate
clp026 – cubelove podcast – Food Chain Magnate
Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 010 – Our 2016 Wishlist
Episode 27 - Tis Better to Have Loved and Lost
Episode 70- Mombasa and Buonocore Hot Seat
Episode 81 -- Eating Cake in Bellevue (Part B, the Second)
Episode 82 -- The Synesthete's Guide to Tasting Purple
Episode 83 -- All Ramshackle and Worry Free
Episode 84 -- Balancing Sandboxes in the Rain
Heavy Cardboard Episode 35 – Food Chain Magnate
Heavy Cardboard Episode 39 – Top 50 Favorite Games of Right Now
Heavy Cardboard Episode 52 – Amanda’s Top 50 & Edward’s Top 50
Low Player Count - Ep 16 - It's BGGcon Y'all!
Low Player Count - Ep 23 - Game Weight
MOBG 41, The one about Tom, Pilgrims and food.
Podcast EP02 – Recommandations de jeux à 2 joueurs
Podcast EP10 – Top 10 jeux de société
The Game Pit - Episode 56 - The Bumper Review of 2015 (with Top 5s)
The Good The Board and The Gettin’ Capped: Episode 85 “Interview with Clay of Capstone Games”
The Good, The Board and The Anticipated: Episode 55 “Games to play in 2016″
The Good, The Board and The Dinner With Caroline: Episode 56 “Randomness”
The Good, The Board and The Pretties: Episode 45 “Miniatures”
The Long View - Food Chain Magnate
제101회 개그세상: 자본주의의 민낯 - Food chain magnate

175916.name: City of Danger
175916.description:
From the front page:

On the southern shores of the Moonsea, the residents of Mulmaster have eked out a living where others would likely have given up long ago—in a bleak city where corruption is rampant and the Church of Bane holds sway. In these five short, introductory adventures, you will travel the breadth of the City of Danger, meet its people, see its sights, and witness firsthand how the city truly has earned its ominous moniker. An introductory adventure for 1st-2nd level characters.

175917.name: Embers of Elmwood
175917.description:
From the front page:

A derelict raft drifts into Mulmaster’s harbor carrying a young woman. Delirious with hunger, the only words she seems able to speak so far have been “ash and fire.” The only other clue to her identity is an ornate tattoo. Is the woman insane, or is something nefarious at play? An adventure for 1st-4th level characters.

175918.name: The Drowned Tower
175918.description:
From the front page:

You are approached by someone claiming to be a member of the Brotherhood of the Cloak investigating unusual incidents involving some of his brethren. Discretion is vital, as there is rumored to be a link between the denizens of the Tower of Arcane Might and one of the elemental cults. Can you uncover the truth? An adventure for 5th-10th level characters.

175919.name: Mayhem in the Earthspur Mines
175919.description:
From the front page:

Riddled with veins of precious ore and gem, the Earthspur Mountains to the west have long been a valuable resource for anyone able to mine them. One such mine has gone silent and the only thing more concerning than its long overdue shipment is the fate of the members of the Soldiery sent to discover what has happened to the mine’s workers. Though the mine lay in a region of the Mountains once claimed by a clan of reclusive dwarves, the Ludwakazar clan wouldn’t be so bold as to violate their long-standing peace with Mulmaster. Or would they? An adventure for 5th-10th level characters.

175920.description:
1066: The Year of Three Battles covers the crucial year in the history of England when three men vied for the throne: Harold Godwinson, king of Wessex, Haraldr Sigurdsson (known as Hardrada), king of Norway, and William, Duke of Normandy. The game presents the three main battles of the campaign — Fulford (20 September), Stamford Bridge (25 September), and Hastings (14 October) — using the Battles of the Medieval World system.

Each battle has its own map, with hexes approximately 55 yards across. Units represent around 200 men and are typed as infantry, archers, and cavalry. Turns are 30 minutes of real time. Combat features a simple odds-based CRT with special rules covering archery and cavalry charges. Key leaders are present and affect unit morale and rally. Each of the games can be played in two hours or less. Players also may choose the campaign scenario, fighting all three battles in sequence, with the outcome of each affecting the forces available in the next.
175920.name: 1066: The Year of Three Battles

175921.description:
Gates of Vienna is a two-player game covering the campaign of 1683 in which an Ottoman army besieged that Habsburg capital only to be defeated by a multi-national Christian counterattack. It was the turning point in the centuries-long Habsburg-Turkish wars.

The Gates of Vienna system is based on the CSR award-winning Red Dragon Rising system. Players conduct actions encompassing discrete combat, logistical, intelligence and other operations. Each turn represents a month. During each turn, players take various actions, alternating one at a time with between each other. That smoothly represents the overall pace of operations in the era while giving play a fast tempo.

Each unit repre­sents anything from an individual regiment to an entire “wing” of an army (approximately 1,000 to 10,000 men). Each amp hex represents 12 miles.
175921.name: Gates of Vienna

175923.description:
Fight the Oogies and build the perfect sandwich - A Card Game of Sandwich Building Fun.

It takes an artist to build the perfect sandwich. Can you be the first to collect and stack fresh ingredients into a hoagie masterpieces before the Oogies, a gang of pesky, ingredient spoiling creatures, destroy your fixings?

Hoagie matches players in a goofy kitchen adventure to create the perfect sandwich while spoiling other players’ ingredients with the Oogies.

This family game is appropriate for players of all ages, from 8 and up. In Hoagie, the game designer developed a game that would be fun both for young children and parents, making this game a valuable part of any family game collection.

Hoagie is a card game. Players are dealt a hand of "ingredient cards" and a few "action cards." Players attempt to build sandwiches by placing ingredient cards such as bread, cheese, meat, and lettuce in front of them, face up on the table, in order. Players may foul other players' ingredients by placing spoiled ingredient cards over opposing sandwiches. Action cards such as "skip" "reverse" and "double-play" add spice to the game.

The first player with an unspoiled hoagie sandwich on the table wins. This game is fast play and simple. Kids love it.
175923.name: Hoagie

175924.name: Trash War
175924.description:
Cry Havoc and let slip the Junk-Yard Dogs of War! The Card Game of Medieval Junk-Yard Combat!

What goes on in the junkyards when nobody is around? After the metal crushers shut down and the land movers roll back into their hangars, after the underpaid employees clock out and call it a night, that’s when the knights arrive,dressed in shimmering armor, impassioned with chivalry and taster for war. It is in the junkyards where these warriors find the tools for battle. And in the landfills, legends are born.

Trash War is a humorous game that pits players against each other in junk yard combat. Each player takes on the role of a medieval knight in a modern junk yard. Players fling trash at each other, everything from broken microwave ovens to mutant albino alligators.

Players set up their ramparts by placing "Wall Cards" on the table before them. A player starts the battle by attacking any opponent's walls. The attacked player then retaliates by attacking any player's walls. Trash War isn't played in standard turn order. Players attack and retaliate against opponents of their choice. In the end, the player with the last wall standing wins.

175925.description:
Die Jagd ("The Hunt") is a freely-downloadable solitaire legend released as chapter 3 of the "Adventure Andor" community forum game. This legend tells of the events back in Andor while most heroes began the journey to the north. It is designed specifically for the (also freely-downloadable) bonus hero Orfen or Marfa, the Wolf Warrior.

German description
“Die Jagd” ist eine neue Bonus-Legende für einen Spieler.
Diese Legende erzählt die Geschehnisse im Lande Andor, während die meisten Helden die Reise in den Norden antraten und ist speziell für den Bonus-Helden Orfen, der Wolfskrieger gestaltet.
175925.name: Die Legenden von Andor: Die Jagd
boardgameexpansion: Legends of Andor: The Star Shield

175926.name: Trivial Pursuit Master 2011 Dansk
175926.description: Classic quiz game. No theme, just updated questions in danish.

175927.name: Hope Inhumanity
175927.description:
From website:

Play ordinary people surviving the extraordinary journey through a post-apocalyptic landscape. Fight off hunger, sickness, and other desperate survivors who want what you want: to find a safe destination where hope still lives. How far will you go to survive?

175928.description: Fluxx: International TableTop Day Expansion has ten cards for use with Fluxx: five new Keepers (Felicia Day, Wil Wheaton, Anne Wheaton, the Loser's Couch, and the Trophy of Awesomeness), four Goals that use these Keepers, and one action card called "Pound on the Table".
175928.name: Fluxx: International TableTop Day Expansion

175929.name: NEVERMIND (2015)
175929.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




Nevermind is a biofeedback-enhanced adventure horror game that takes you into the dark and twisted world of the subconscious.

As you explore surreal labyrinths and solve the puzzles of the mind, a biofeedback sensor will monitor how scared or stressed you become moment-to-moment. If you let your fears get the best of you, the game will become harder. If you’re able to calm yourself in the face of terror, the game will be more forgiving.

Nevermind strives to create a haunting gameplay experience that also teaches you how to be more aware of your internal responses to stressful situations. If you can learn to control your anxiety within the disturbing realm of Nevermind, just imagine what you can do when it comes to those inevitable stressful moments in the real world…

Source: The Game Website.

175930.name: Nevermind
175930.description:
The game was often given to UK Amiga owners who had sent their machine for repair. The repair centres in the UK sent this title (among others) as sort of compensation for their machine going faulty.

The game is played in a 3D isometric environment. Each isometric square represents a tile. At the beginning of each level, a picture made up of sixteen tiles will be displayed to the player. The computer will then rearrange the tiles which make up the picture, and distribute some in other areas of the level. The player's task is to restore the picture to the way it looked at the beginning of the level. This is achieved by walking around the isometric world, picking up tiles, and placing them in the correct place. Throughout a level, warps must be found which allow the player to change from walking on the floor to walking on the walls. Each level has a time limit. If the time runs out, the player loses. When the picture is complete, the player progresses to the next level.

From level two onwards, chess pieces patrol the level. The chess pieces may move correctly placed tiles to somewhere else on the level, or block the player's path. In addition, later levels contain several pictures, and several screens.

Source: Wikipedia, "Nevermind (game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

175931.name: A Game for Good Christians: Why We Can't Have Nice Things
175931.description:
The Why We Can’t Have Nice Things Expansion Deck includes such biblical gems as:

Your father being your grandfather and uncle (Genesis 19:30-38)
Being liable for morons falling off your roof (Deuteronomy 22:8)
Loving God while not being a dick to everyone else (The whole sum of the Law, the Prophets, and the Gospel)

175932.name: A Game for Good Christians: Wisdom Decks
175932.description:
The Wisdom Books Expansion Deck (with content taken from the books of Job, Psalms, Proverbs, Ecclesiastes, and Songs of Solomon) with sage words like:
You: an arrow from your father’s quiver (Psalm 127:4-5)
A virtuous woman as defined by old Jewish men (Proverbs 31)
Going down to the nut orchard (Song of Solomon 6:11)

175933.name: Mein erstes Krabbelkäfer Spiel
175933.description:
A children's game in which the first player to collect all 7 bugs on his/her player board wins.

Game play:
The bug chits (ants, spiders, butterflies, bees, caterpillars, ladybugs) are put on six cardboard leaves in different shapes. Players take turns rolling the two dice. One die shows the leaf shapes, the other the bugs. The combination shows which bug the active player may take and put on his/her board. The empty spot is then filled with a new bug. If the combination from the roll doesn't exist, the player has to hope for better luck next round.

175935.name: Monstrocards
175935.description: Monstrocards is a party card game in which players quickly create their own cards and pit them against other players’ cards in a series of duels. Because you don’t have much time to create your deck, what comes out is often weird, sometimes creepy, and usually hilarious. When two players pit their cards against each other, the players who aren’t dueling vote on which card wins.

175936.name: Arcasam: Beat The Dragon
175936.description:
Arcasam: Beat The Dragon is a strategy role-playing game for 2 - 5 players. In this game, where you can fight monsters as well as your opponents, and get a reward if you win the fight. At the end, when you are strong and equipped enough, you can dare to fight and beat the evil Dragon - which is menacing the world of Arcasam - before your opponents do. You will get better, stronger and more powerful each round, however your victory depends on the strategy you choose.

Setup
There are 7 big hexes in the game - 1 center hex, which is the Dragon's den and 6 other hexes creating the terrain. The shape of the game board varies according to the number of players - it is versatile. This will guarantee that the game board will be always adequate - not too big, not too small.

Each hex contains 5 slots - you can place a castle, tavern, iron mine, tailor, tanner, orchard or monsters there. You can place them evenly or randomly. This factor contributes to the variability of the game as well.

Apart from the game board, each player has his own player board in front of him. He can mark his place a weapon there, place his companion card as well as mark his current attack, defence and health points. The last component is a main board, where players count the rounds and phases of the game.

Game Play Overview
Each round,player has a fixed number of steps he can make (at the beginning it is 13) and during his turn, he can step on/pass through the following:


Empty spot: No action
Iron mine / Tailor / Tanner / Orchard: You will get the supply of iron / cloth / leather / food. Materials (iron, cloth and leather) are needed when you want to buy a weapon and upgrade your skill tree. Without weapon, you cannot fight the monsters and your opponents.
Monster: Once you step on this slot, you have to fight the particular monster. If you win, you get a precious piece of gold along with the loot.
Castle: In the castle, you can buy weapons needed for the fights, or you can improve your skill tree.
Tavern: Each time you pass through the tavern, you have to draw 1 companion card, where you will find some kind of advantage. In the tavern, you can be also healed after the fight. (1 step = 1 life).


If you encounter one of your opponents during your round and you both already have a weapon, you or him can choose to fight one another. The winner gets 8 materials from the backpack of the loser and the loser will have to get healed in the tavern.

So, you can fight either the monster or one of your opponents. The system of the monster fight is different than the system of the fight with your opponent. Weapons have different costs, however you always need to pay one piece of gold which you can get only if you beat the monster.

-Fight with your opponents

When one hero encounters another one, and both of them have a weapon, each of them can choose to start a fight. For 1 food they can always draw 2 action cards (they can be either attack or defense) but the maximum they can have in hand is 10.

Hero who chose to fight his opponent starts and plays an attack. The attacked has to have a defense card in order not to loose any lives. Then the other player (attacked) plays an attack and and the attacker has to play a defense. If one of the players does not have a defence card, he has to subtract certain number of lives, depending on the attack of the attacker and defense of the attacked. If one of the players has 0 lives, he lost the fight and has to give 8 materials from his backpack to his opponent. Then he has to get healed to the tavern.

-Fight with the monsters

Fight with the monster is much easier then the fight with other hero. Each monster has certain number of lives and strength of his attack, depending on the phase of the game. This is the only part of the game where player uses the dice. Depending on the number the player rolled on the dice and on the current phase of the game (1,2,3), monster attacks with a certain strength. The player has to play defence cards in order not to loose the fight. Then he has to play the attack cards to beat the monster, depending on number of lives the particular monster has, and on the weapon the hero has. If the hero wins, he will take 1 gold and choose 1 loot, where he can find some kind of advantage.

The fight with the Dragon is the same as a fight with other monsters, but he is very strong, so the player has to be very well equiped and experienced.

175937.name: Imbued with Magic
175937.description:
From publisher blurb:

Who doesn't want more magic items?

Inside are 15 new magic items to use in your 5th edition campaign. Some are throwbacks to old favorites in past editions, some are brand new, ready to surprise your players with!

175938.name: New Twists on Old Monsters
175938.description:
From publisher blurb:

Looking for monsters that do more?

Inside are 15 new monsters to use in your 5th edition campaign. Some are throwbacks to old favorites in past editions, some are brand new, ready to surprise your players with!

175939.name: Fierce Tempers
175939.description:
From publisher blurb:

For a level 8 party!

A duergar mining expedition has led to a curious find - the entrance to the mythical Forge of Creation, where the first dwarves supposedly created the tools that brought civilization to the world. Their discovery has not gone unnoticed though, as their toiling within the forge has activated a portal to the Elemental Plane of Fire, drawing the attention of the efreeti Camus, Eyes of Midnight.

The PCs are caught in a clash between the efreeti sultan and the meddlesome duergar, and must survive threats from each faction and the dangers that lurk within the forge itself!

175940.name: The Inner City: Tired Places, Mad Faces
175940.description:
From publisher blurb:

The dark alleys and murderous Nightmares filling the Mad City are nothing but twisted reflections of the Awake. This hack helps your group collaboratively create their own little broken shard of the Mad City to explore during play. Use their exhaustion talents as inspiration for bizarre new places and their madness talents to spawn new Nightmares.

This product is a hack / expansion for the fantastic game Don't Rest your Head by Evil Hat Productions. This was originally submitted as part of the "Don't Hack This Game" anthology by Evil Hat Productions, published with permission.

175941.name: Mase
175941.description:
From publisher blurb:

Meet MASE!!

Never-before-available in any format! The newest release from Les Supérieurs corner in the WatchGuard Universe! This WWII veteran, and the first of a new generation of "emergent" metahuman heroes, is the lastest Canadian character to grace your adventures! Smart, strong, strategic, and a master mechanic & marksman, there are so many great things to love about Mase -- find out for yourself!

175942.name: Alternate Victory Volume One
175942.description:
From publisher blurb:


How do YOU want your Victory today?

Alternate Victory is a fresh collection of optional rules for your Victory System campaigns. Need to tweak your Victory System game to get the gaming experience you want? Try some of THESE tweaks on for size!

A complete listing of all Merits, Flaws, and Skills added in supplements since the Core Rulebook was published
Grim and Gritty Healing for healing rules that are less Cinematic and more Problematic!
The Draining; when acquiring Special Abilities like Magic, Psionics, or Mechanica becomes a horrific burden on the soul as well as the bank account!
Tactical Victory: Rules for using tactical combat in your Victory System games!
Quantumsong: An alternative form of narrative "magick" that allows Characters to bend reality itself with an effort of will




Want to do things a little differently? Have a look at some of these alternative rules, and see how far you can push the envelope. Know Victory, Know Risk; No Risk, No Victory!

175943.name: Vision-Ka (Issue 1 - Dec 2001)
175943.description:
(translated) from the cover:

Fanzine Nephilim


Players aid
Parallèles et délires
2 Scénarios

175944.name: Vision-Ka (Issue 2 - Printemps 2002)
rpgissuearticle: Nephilim avec un jeu de tarot
175944.description:
(translated) from table of content:

For Nephilim


Crossed destiny
The Salomon seal
Nephilim with tarot
Glyph of magic guard
Archemie
Iram
Habitus
Voors mythology
A scenario
Constellation project: invisible history

175945.description:
The Dark Lord's spies have infiltrated the White City, and their nefarious Plot threatens to plunge all of Gondor into darkness. It's up to your heroes to cleanse Minas Tirith of this evil, but The Steward's Fear Nightmare Deck ensures that the conspiracies run deeper than ever, your foes are more cunning and deadly, and the fate of Gondor rests upon a razor's edge!

Nightmare Decks for The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game allow you to revisit your favorite scenarios cast in the shadows of the game's challenging Nightmare Mode. Featuring deadlier enemies, darker locations, and more terrifying surprises, each Nightmare Deck introduces new, alternate encounter cards and instructions for using them to reshape a scenario's encounter deck. The result? A nightmarish journey through territory you thought you knew, but with twists and turns that will have you on the edge of your seat!
175945.name: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – Nightmare Deck: The Steward's Fear
boardgameexpansion: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game
The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – The Steward's Fear
boardgamefamily: Lord of the Rings: The Card Game (LCG)

175946.description:
As your heroes pursue the Dark Lord's servants into the Drúadan Forest, a surprising revelation and new mechanics thrust you into a desperate battle for your lives! The Drúadan Forest Nightmare Deck ensures that the forest's Wose enemies and their Prowl mechanics make powerful impacts from the game's outset, all the way through its dramatic conclusion.

Nightmare Decks for The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game allow you to revisit your favorite scenarios cast in the shadows of the game's challenging Nightmare Mode. Featuring deadlier enemies, darker locations, and more terrifying surprises, each Nightmare Deck introduces new, alternate encounter cards and instructions for using them to reshape a scenario's encounter deck. The result? A nightmarish journey through territory you thought you knew, but with twists and turns that will have you on the edge of your seat!
175946.name: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – Nightmare Deck: The Drúadan Forest
boardgameexpansion: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game
The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – The Drúadan Forest
boardgamefamily: Lord of the Rings: The Card Game (LCG)

175947.description:
The villagers of Amon Dîn are besieged by a marauding band of Orcs, and only your heroes can save them! However, as you rush to their aid, the Encounter at Amon Dîn Nightmare Deck ensures that you'll be forced into hard choices at every turn. Will you save the villagers, or will you save yourselves? The more villagers you try to save, the more you put your lives at risk. It's time to rise to new heights of heroism!

Nightmare Decks for The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game allow you to revisit your favorite scenarios cast in the shadows of the game's challenging Nightmare Mode. Featuring deadlier enemies, darker locations, and more terrifying surprises, each Nightmare Deck introduces new, alternate encounter cards and instructions for using them to reshape a scenario's encounter deck. The result? A nightmarish journey through territory you thought you knew, but with twists and turns that will have you on the edge of your seat!
175947.name: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – Nightmare Deck: Encounter at Amon Dîn
boardgameexpansion: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game
The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – Encounter at Amon Dîn
boardgamefamily: Lord of the Rings: The Card Game (LCG)

175949.description:
March to war with Lord Boromir and the Assault on Osgiliath Nightmare Deck! The Assault on Osgiliath scenario challenges you to seize control of every Osgiliath location in play, and the new setup and encounter cards in this Nightmare Deck add to the ferocity of the forces that oppose you, even as they add new strategic dimensions to your ongoing struggles. In Nightmare Mode, you'll find that the scenario's enemies and treachery cards get stronger with the number of locations the players control, and your battle for Osgiliath will be fierce, bloody, and full of changes in momentum. Victory would mean a major blow against the Enemy, one wrong move could cost you the whole war.

Nightmare Decks for The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game allow you to revisit your favorite scenarios cast in the shadows of the game's challenging Nightmare Mode. Featuring deadlier enemies, darker locations, and more terrifying surprises, each Nightmare Deck introduces new, alternate encounter cards and instructions for using them to reshape a scenario's encounter deck. The result? A nightmarish journey through territory you thought you knew, but with twists and turns that will have you on the edge of your seat!
175949.name: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – Nightmare Deck: Assault on Osgiliath
boardgameexpansion: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game
The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – Assault on Osgiliath
boardgamefamily: Lord of the Rings: The Card Game (LCG)

175950.description:
When your heroes chase after a band of Orcs fleeing into the woods of Ithilien, their hunt leads them perilously close to the hidden enemies from The Blood of Gondor Nightmare Deck. In The Blood of Gondor, your heroes are ambushed on all sides by "hidden cards," which enter your play area facedown until different effects force them to flip over. The Blood of Gondor Nightmare Deck amplifies the tension and excitement this mechanic creates, adding more effects that cause you to take hidden cards, more effects that flip them over, and a number of nasty surprises that trigger when they're flipped faceup.

Nightmare Decks for The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game allow you to revisit your favorite scenarios cast in the shadows of the game's challenging Nightmare Mode. Featuring deadlier enemies, darker locations, and more terrifying surprises, each Nightmare Deck introduces new, alternate encounter cards and instructions for using them to reshape a scenario's encounter deck. The result? A nightmarish journey through territory you thought you knew, but with twists and turns that will have you on the edge of your seat!
175950.name: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – Nightmare Deck: The Blood of Gondor
boardgameexpansion: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game
The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – The Blood of Gondor
boardgamefamily: Lord of the Rings: The Card Game (LCG)

175951.description:
Embark upon a desperate quest to rescue Faramir from the clutches of the Dark Lord's servants. Time is against you, as are the treacherous paths and noxious fumes of the shadowed land through which you must race. Along your way, you must defeat scores of Orcs, agents of Mordor, and three powerful Captains, each of which gains strength and resilience from The Morgul Vale Nightmare Deck! In Nightmare Mode, you have less time to free Faramir than ever before, and every decision you make throughout your quest will play a part in determining whether you succeed, or whether Faramir falls prey to the Nazgûl!

Nightmare Decks for The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game allow you to revisit your favorite scenarios cast in the shadows of the game's challenging Nightmare Mode. Featuring deadlier enemies, darker locations, and more terrifying surprises, each Nightmare Deck introduces new, alternate encounter cards and instructions for using them to reshape a scenario's encounter deck. The result? A nightmarish journey through territory you thought you knew, but with twists and turns that will have you on the edge of your seat!
175951.name: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – Nightmare Deck: The Morgul Vale
boardgameexpansion: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game
The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – The Morgul Vale
boardgamefamily: Lord of the Rings: The Card Game (LCG)

boardgamepublisher: Winning Moves Germany (Winning Moves Deutschland GmbH)
175952.description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.
